Archaicopia.modifiers:
<trait category="Buff" icon="Units/Neutral/Artefacts/Healing" stacking="1">
	<perTurnModifiers endure="0">
		<modifier>
			<conditions>
				<player>
					<noFaction name="Neutral"/>
				</player>
			</conditions>
			<effects>
				<hitpoints add="0.5"/>
			</effects>
		</modifier>
	</perTurnModifiers>
</trait>

Adamantium Weave Vest.flavor: When you want to make something invulnerable, you make it from adamantium. Used in the construction of both Terminator Armour or the construction of Titans, this is the strongest material known to man. This vest only has a tiny amount in it, woven in with plasteel and ceramite, but it's enough to make it exceedingly protective.

Armaplas Bracers.flavor: Made of the same material as the Imperial Carapace Armour, these matched sets of arm shields mildly increase the wearer's survivability. It's the built-in tactical cogitators, however, that give the wearer a much better hope of living through the next fight.

Axe of Blind Fury.description: Item that grants a cleave effect to all melee weapons.
Axe of Blind Fury.flavor: Bound within this fabled axe is the essence of a Greater Daemon. It rages against its eternity of servitude, resulting in grievous violence against the enemy and, sometimes, its owner!

Combat Stimulant.flavor: Combat Stimulants like Frenzon or Onslaught are regarded with distaste by most species, given that their manufacture and testing sometimes require the liquidation of innocent victims (especially if Slaaneshi cults are involved). Despite this, the Imperial forces dispense these regularly to both Penal Legions and the much-feared Eversor Assassins.

Concealed Weapon System.flavor: Hiding a weapon isn't a new idea, but a true Concealed Weapon System secretes the killing tool in such a way that it's undetectable until use—as clothing, jewellery or even as biological elements. The element of surprise heavily increases its efficacy.

Dusk Blade.description: Item that grants life steal to all melee weapons.
Dusk Blade.flavor: The Dawn Blade that the traitor Commander Farsight discovered was unique—but to erase his memory Earth Caste artisans and Water Caste diplomats created this weapon for Coldflame. It may look the same as the iconic Dawn Blade, but it possesses none of its unearthly power—instead, the advanced medical technology embedded in it can draw on the battlesuit’s power to heal the wielder.

Endurance Implant.flavor: An atypical Jokaero device, this implant weaves its way into the host organism, to optimise its biological systems. Its user will find itself tireless, able to run faster, fight for longer, and generally keep going—until its overwrought body gives way, that is.

Entropic Locum.description: Item that increases the armour penetration.
Entropic Locum.flavor: Apparently using similar design principles to a Graviton Gun, this Jokaero device can be used alongside a gunsight or parallel to a weapon’s blade. When activated, it causes the molecules in a very small volume of the target to become disordered and collapse inwards, leading to a single weak spot on the target that your weapon just happens to already be pointing at.

Faolch\u00fa's Wing.description: Item that consumes action to increase movement.
Faolch\u00fa's Wing.flavor: When Eldanesh fell battling Khaine, the great falcon Faolchú was disconsolate. Faolchú gifted a single golden pinfeather to Eldanesh’s heirs, that perhaps its swiftness might aid them where her own had failed. Legend tells that this artefact is that selfsame token of grief, handed down through generations of Aeldari, and surviving even the tumult of the Fall.

Lightning Gauntlet.description: Item that increases the damage of the next melee attack.
Lightning Gauntlet.flavor: With talons created from adamantium and the telltale blue glow of a power weapon, Lightning Claws are normally only mounted on Terminator armour. However rare single gauntlets can be found small enough to be carried by a normal warrior.

Mourning Blade Of Lazaerek.description: Item that increases the melee damage and melee armour penetration.
Mourning Blade Of Lazaerek.flavor: Little survived when an apparently disastrous jump saw the last remnants of the Fire Hawks Chapter lost to the warp in 963.M41, but a few alleged relics yet remain. This axe was thought to belong to their rancorous grand master, Stibor Lazaerek, under whose command the Chapter's ranks were decimated during the lethal rebellions of the Badab War.
Mourning Blade Of Lazaerek.modifiers:
<trait visibilityCategory="Weapon" category="Buff" icon="Items/MourningBladeOfLazaerek">
	<modifiers>
		<modifier>
			<conditions>
				<weapon>
					<trait name="Melee"/>
				</weapon>
			</conditions>
			<effects>
				<armorPenetration add="2"/>
				<damage mul="0.25"/>
			</effects>
		</modifier>
	</modifiers>
</trait>

Omni-Scope.description: Item that increases the ranged accuracy.
Omni-Scope.flavor: A rare Imperial weapon sight, the Omni-Scope consists of a precision lens aligned to a cluster of sensors, including telescopic and multi-spectrum vision modes. The user can either use the sight manually or through a direct input that plugs into bionics, biologics or other interfaces. The latter interface enables remote sight and control with any weapon—making it favoured by assassins Imperium-wide.

Powered Gauntlet.description: Item that increases the melee damage.
Powered Gauntlet.flavor: This may look like a simple steel glove, with randomly-placed technology all over it. Yet, as the Administratum say, 'caveat emptor'—for the Jokaero technology in it makes it the match of the larger power fists and power claws employed by the Imperial and Ork forces.

Scrolls of Magnus.description: Item that increases the research output.
Scrolls of Magnus.flavor: These illuminated pages of skin are fragments of the repository of sorcery compiled by the Primarch of the Thousand Sons, and contain arcane lore from across the galaxy. None possess them for long and remain sane, for they have their own ghastly sentience.

Sightless Helm.description: Item that grants the ability to ignore ranged damage reduction and increases the ranged accuracy.
Sightless Helm.flavor: The lenses of this helm remain forever dark, the wearer unable to perceive the galaxy with their own eyes. Instead, strange warp senses are granted by the helms machine spirit, illuminating the foe’s weaknesses.

Tantalising Icon.description: Item that increases the influence output.
Tantalising Icon.flavor: Carved from wraithbone stolen from the hearts of fallen Craftworlds, this elongated form represents Slaanesh in all their glory. Few mortal eyes could rest upon this icon and not lust for it—for Slaanesh—and begin their fall from grace.

Temporary Shield.flavor: Portable shield generators are fairly rare amongst most species, given the technical capability and rare resources needed to make them. They also burn out quickly, but their ability to stop even the most powerful attacks dead in their tracks make them invaluable.

Ultra Wideband Auspex.description: Item that prevents the unit from being targeted by overwatch attacks.
Ultra Wideband Auspex.flavor: To hide yourself, you don’t always need diffraction fields or chameleonic skin—sometimes just knowing more than the enemy is enough. An advanced Auspex uses passive and active sensors to discern the location of every enemy unit so the bearer can decide how best to engage them—or avoid them—at will.

Volcanis Shroud.description: Item that increases the witchfire damage reduction.
Volcanis Shroud.flavor: Though this battered, heat-resistant armour was originally designed for industrial work at the deepest and most hazardous layers of Hive Worlds, by some happy accident it also muffles psychic attack. As yet, whatever gives the Shroud this quality has not been identified, for fear that reverse-engineering it may break its uncanny spell.

Zoat Hide Jerkin.description: Item that increases the hitpoints and healing rate.
Zoat Hide Jerkin.flavor: The Zoat, a genetically-engineered slave race in the thrall of the Tyranids, have been all but absent from the galaxy for generations. Though renowned for their unusual intelligence and charisma, their dense, scaled skin also made them a frighteningly resilient foe. Zoat-hide armour is vanishingly rare now, but a true boon upon the battlefield.

Adjacency Integration.description: Increases the research output for each building in an adjacent tile.
Adjacency Integration.flavor: The rediscovery of knowledge is such a holy rite, that supporting rites have been mandated throughout the Hive. As population density grows, the faithful constantly pour libations and imprecate the city’s integrated machine spirits to give up their secrets to the Tech-Priests in the Librarium Omnis.

Aggression Override.flavor: Employing data-refined kill-canticle protocols, the Marshal ensures his Skitarii are driven into a state of heightened ferocity that sees their bloodstreams boil with combat hyperstimulants.

Aggressor Imperative.description: Increases the movement, but decreases the armour.
Aggressor Imperative.flavor: The Skitarii feel the press of an invisible hand upon their minds as the Machine God drives them forward. Servos are pushed to their structural limits as fibre bundles fill with the boundless energy of the Motive Force and propel the faithful on an unstoppable crusade.

Dogma Metalica.flavor: The zealots of Metalica are famed for bringing with them an ear-shattering clamour, redolent of their forge world’s endless industry—and for not pausing in their relentless advance, obliterating their foes mid-march.

Benediction of Omniscience.flavor: Those blessed enough to comprehend this blaring vox-prayer find their targeting reticules guided by the Omnissiah’s own vigilance.

Bionics.flavor: It’s a rare Adeptus Mechanicus Magos who goes completely unaugmented, since the days of Arkhan Land. Some, vainer, conceal their augmentation, but most bionic augmentation is deliberately crude and inhuman, acting as physical symbols of the Omnissiah’s blessing.

Broad Spectrum Data-Tether.flavor: A vehicle-mounted version of that carried by veteran Skitarii, the broad spectrum data-tether projects a Tech-Priest’s binharic blurts with such clarity it seems he is amongst the ranks of the Skitarii himself. Imperatives delivered via such information relays are more potent and reliable than any other.

Bulwark Imperative.description: Increases the armour, but decreases the movement.
Bulwark Imperative.flavor: The warrior wisdom of ancient and experienced Reductors is force-loaded into the Skitarii’s minds. Each thrilling pulse of data locks microactuators into bracing positions, brings reserve power cells online and bestows a sensation of sacred invulnerability upon the Tech-Priests’ soldiers.

Canticles of the Omnissiah.flavor: In times of war, the disciples of the Omnissiah incant complex war-blessings. These are as much optimisation subroutines as they are expressions of faith in their all-knowing, all-comprehending deity.

Chant of the Remorseless Fist.flavor: In spitting out a staccato chant to the Motive Force, the faithful warriors of the Cult Mechanicus are filled with merciless surety as well as intent.

Mavoraforming.flavor: Terraforming is the ironically-named process of making a planet more livable for humans, exactly unlike the devastated bulk of Earth, hidden beneath the continent-sprawling Imperial Palace. Mavoraforming has no such pretensions, turning a planet into an exploited, poisoned dotted with incredibly productive cities, just like home.

Hive World Approval.flavor: The final conversion of a planet to a Hive World is visible from space. Gone are the rolling hills, the valleys, the trees. Vanished the lakes, seas and breathable atmosphere. Biting grit blows over dust bowls where a few recalcitrant Imperials eke out subsistence farms in the shadows of sky-piercing Hive spires, filled with billions of souls.

Cognis.flavor: Cognis weaponry, though superficially similar to that used by the rest of the Imperium, has one vital difference – a cognis weapon’s machine spirit has been permanently awakened by the rites of the Machine God. When the wielder is unable to give his full concentration, the warlike spirit of the gun will take over.

Command Uplink.flavor:
“You may feel fear, you may want to flee; but when your Magos can, with a thought, stop your limbs taking a single step back, well, then you fight anyway.”
—Marshal Diktum

Conqueror Imperative.description: Increases the melee accuracy, but decreases the ranged accuracy.
Conqueror Imperative.flavor: When the enemy close in, the Tech-Priests controlling each maniple inload Conqueror imperatives that boost the martial subroutines of their Skitarii minions and galvanise them into physical action at the expense of their more elaborate targeting programmes.

Control Edict.flavor: A Doctrina Imperative is hardly a subtle tool, disabling a soldier just as much as it enables them elsewhere. Yet, the attentions of an experienced Marshal can aid in overcoming the Imperative’s cruder commands, enabling the soldier to perform far above their nominal norms.

Darting Hunters.flavor: Pteraxii’s reflexes are accentuated by paring back elements of cogitation that impede their primary function.

Data-Blessed Autosermon.description: Grants research when killing an enemy.
Data-Blessed Autosermon.flavor: Struck with an infoload of revelation, truly blessed Tech-Priests will override the sacred canticles to deliver the Machine God’s adaptive wisdom.

Doctrina Imperatives.flavor: The Skitarii are fearsome foes, relentless in the pursuit of the Omnissiah’s agenda and equipped with the most advanced weaponry in the Imperium. Ultimately, though, each is but a cybernetic vessel for the will of the Tech-Priests. In the heat of battle, the Skitarii will be remotely controlled by data imperatives that boost their minds and bodies to inhuman levels.

Dunestrider.flavor: Some Skitarii are able to march across the most hostile terrain at relentless pace, their augmetic limbs never tiring nor wearing out.

Emanatus Force Field.flavor: The overlapping force fields generated by Dunecrawlers are marvels of military science. Much like the refractor fields common to the lesser orders of the Martian Priesthood, they disperse hostile energies into the atmosphere, each incoming bullet transformed into little more than a flash of actinic blue light and a sudden tang of ozone.

Enhanced Data-Tether.flavor: Seen as the mouthpieces of the Tech-Priests, who in turn are the prophets of the Machine God himself, those honoured with bearing enhanced data-tethers are obeyed without hesitation by their reverent Skitarii comrades.

Enriched Rounds.flavor: Sanctified with the Tri-fold Litany, each of these slugs has spent a decade in the oldest and most irradiated forge temple to certify their lethality. When the Marshal hands them out to his maniples, they know they must make every shot count.

Enslaved to the Past.flavor: Ultimately the Cult’s citadels of knowledge are built upon a foundation of lies. The ability to truly innovate has long been lost, replaced with a reverence for the times when Humanity was the architect of its own destiny. No longer the master of its creations, the Cult Mechanicus is enslaved to the past. It maintains the glories of yesteryear with rite, dogma and edict instead of discernment and comprehension. Even the theoretically simple process of activating a weapon is preceded by the application of ritual oils, the burning of sacred resins and the chanting of long and complex hymns. And yet so long as the process works – or rather, so long as the Cult’s armies can obliterate those who displease them – the Tech-Priests are content to tread the slippery path toward entropy and ignorance.

Guldires Orison.flavor: Guldire was a Chief Warpsmith of the Word Bearers under Erebus. His ‘Orison’ is a prayer of pure corrupted machine code, carrying demonic whispers from the heart of the Warp. Though rendered non-lethal by Imperial defenses, it is still incredibly distracting…

Fidorum Voss Prime.description: Increases the influence output for each building in an adjacent tile.
Fidorum Voss Prime.flavor: The Cult Mechanicus Priesthood venerate the Forge World of Voss Prime for its loyalty above all others—its loyalty to the Imperium is second-to-none. Even when Mars itself fell to the Dark Mechanicum, Voss Prime continued to churn out armaments and was instrumental in the defeat of the Horus Heresy.

Galvanic Field.flavor: Using the Motive Force contained within a large galvanic cell, the Manipulus’s electropositors can infuse the weaponry of nearby allies with the underlying current of all life, carrying the Omnissiah sacred benedictions forward to cast all heretics down.

Entropic Destabilisation.flavor: You are invigorated by the Omnissiah’s blessing! Nothing can stand in your way (is this a dream? Did you see the Omnissiah?!)

Scriptorum Ordinatus.flavor: The Ordinati are unique titan-sized devices, each built for a unique purpose and closely guarded. Your researches have unearthed approved teachings taken from the creation of Ordinatus Oberon, a track-mounted starship cannon employed during the Wars for Armageddon.

Icons of the Omnissiah.description: Increases the loyalty output for each building in an adjacent tile.
Icons of the Omnissiah.flavor: Protect us, master. Free us, Machine God. The Omnissiah comes. The Omnissiah comes. THE OMNISSIAH COMES. Punish the flesh.

Incense Cloud.flavor: The secrets behind Aldebrac Vingh’s creation of the perpetual motion engines that power the ancient Ironstriders has been lost, so they are venerated indeed by the Cultists of Mars. The sacred incense that enshrouds them is both a symbol of their veneration and an effective cover against enemy fire.

Incantation of the Iron Soul.flavor: Raising their voices in binharic praise, the Disciples of the Machine God bolster their spirits with the surety of iron.

Invocation of Machine-Might.flavor: The Tech-Priests lead their minions in a binharic prayer that sends miraculous strength surging through tendons, wires and pistons.

Ion Shield.flavor: Knights carry potent field generators called ion shields. These devices use ancient technology to project an energy field across a narrow arc. By moving the position of the shield so that it intercepts enemy attacks, a Knight is able to survive even the heaviest fire, whilst still being able to fire its own weapons in return. The exact setting and positioning of the shield is essential, as the ion shield is only designed to deflect and slow shots, rather than absorb them in the manner of the void shields used on Imperial Titans. This means the effectiveness of the shield is dependent on the skill and experience of its operator.

Lord of the Machine Cult.flavor:
“You may say, it is impossible for a man to become like the Machine. And I would reply, that only the smallest mind strives to comprehend its limits.”
—Fabricator General Kane
Lord of the Machine Cult.modifiers:
<trait category="Buff" icon="Actions/AdeptusMechanicus/LordOfTheMachineCult" rankMax="2">
	<modifiers>
		<modifier>
			<conditions>
				<unit>
					<allied/>
					<faction name="AdeptusMechanicus"/>
					<trait name="Vehicle"/>
				</unit>
			</conditions>
			<effects>
				<accuracy addMin="1" addMax="3"/>
			</effects>
		</modifier>
	</modifiers>
</trait>

Lucian Specialisation.description: Increases the resource output of non-headquarters buildings of the same type on a tile.
Lucian Specialisation.flavor: Inside the hollow Forge World of Lucius is a trapped sun, but to the Adeptus Mechanicus that is less interesting than the planet’s specialisations—a unique metal “Luciun” and warp travel. Magi of Lucius encourage specialisation in depth.
Lucian Specialisation.modifiers:
<trait category="Buff" visibilityCategory="Building">
	<modifiers>
		<modifier>
			<conditions>
				<building>
					<noTrait name="Headquarters"/>
				</building>
				<building match="Any">
					<energy greater="0"/>
					<food greater="0"/>
					<influence greater="0"/>
					<loyalty greater="0"/>
					<ore greater="0"/>
					<production greater="0"/>
					<research greater="0"/>
				</building>
			</conditions>
			<effects>
				<monolithicBuildingsBonus add="0.017"/>
			</effects>
		</modifier>
	</modifiers>
</trait>

Mechanicus Locum.description: Increases the influence and research output.
Mechanicus Locum.flavor: Every congregation of Tech-Priests comprises masters of arcane knowledge—zealous leaders of man and machine.

Ryzan Savagery.flavor: Despite the planet’s specialisation in plasma and shielding devices, so common are Ork invasions on the Forge World of Ryza that the defenders are known for their Ork-esque enthusiasm for melee combat.

Monolithic Buildings.description: Increases the resource output of non-headquarters buildings of the same type on a tile. Decreases the output of non-headquarters buildings of differing types on a tile.
Monolithic Buildings.flavor:
“In uniformity, specialisations. In specialisation, efficiency. In efficiency, ecstasy.”
—Kelphor Zhuko-Dim, Arch Flagellant
Monolithic Buildings.modifiers:
<trait category="Buff" visibilityCategory="Building">
	<modifiers>
		<modifier>
			<conditions>
				<building>
					<noTrait name="Headquarters"/>
				</building>
				<building match="Any">
					<energy greater="0"/>
					<food greater="0"/>
					<influence greater="0"/>
					<loyalty greater="0"/>
					<ore greater="0"/>
					<production greater="0"/>
					<research greater="0"/>
				</building>
			</conditions>
			<effects>
				<monolithicBuildingsBonus add="0.05"/>
				<monolithicBuildingsPenalty add="-0.05"/>
			</effects>
		</modifier>
	</modifiers>
</trait>

Neurostatic Interface.description: Increases the damage reduction when attacked by adjacent enemy units.
Neurostatic Interface.flavor: Amidst the audio-visual cacophony accompanied by a Sicarian Infiltrator attack is wide-band electromagnetic interference, designed to cripple enemy systems and set nerves jangling.

Omnispex.flavor: The omnispex carries a raptor-class machine spirit that can read heat emissions, data signatures, and biological waveforms even at extreme range. Should it be kept focussed for an extended period of time, it will determine the weak points of those it scrutinises and pass them on to its master.

Optate Restrictions.flavor: The Optates who control Hive City populations have agreed to release breeding restrictions. In practice, this means removal of anaphrodisiacs from ration packs, rather than the construction of new buildings—the existing living spaces just get that much more crowded instead…

Power Surge.description: Increases the output of non-headquarters buildings.
Power Surge.flavor:
“Throw open the transonic oscillator and escalate the dereactor another three points. I require those forges running at optimal efficiency!”
—Archmagos Dyatskin, shortly before the loss of Arklis Hive Primus
Power Surge.modifiers:
<trait alwaysVisible="1" category="Buff" icon="Actions/AdeptusMechanicus/PowerSurge" visibilityCategory="Tile">
	<modifiers>
		<modifier>
			<conditions>
				<building>
					<noTrait name="Headquarters"/>
				</building>
			</conditions>
			<effects>
				<production mul="0.125"/>
				<food mul="0.25"/>
				<ore mul="0.25"/>
				<energy mul="0.25"/>
				<research mul="0.25"/>
				<influence mul="0.25"/>
				<loyalty mul="0.25"/>
			</effects>
		</modifier>
		<modifier requiredUpgrade="AdeptusMechanicus/ThermoExchangeEfficiency">
			<conditions>
				<building>
					<noTrait name="Headquarters"/>
				</building>
			</conditions>
			<effects>
				<production mul="0.05"/>
				<food mul="0.1"/>
				<ore mul="0.1"/>
				<energy mul="0.1"/>
				<research mul="0.1"/>
				<influence mul="0.1"/>
				<loyalty mul="0.1"/>
			</effects>
		</modifier>
	</modifiers>
</trait>

Protector Imperative.description: Increases the ranged accuracy, but decreases the melee accuracy.
Protector Imperative.flavor: The Protector imperative is codified to yield the maximum spectra of hard data. Extra power is fed into narrow-band optics and rangefinders connected directly to the Skitarii’s priority programming as the holy warriors’ guns become an extension of themselves.

Rad Poisoning.description: Increases the damage against infantry and monstrous creature units.

Rad-Saturation.flavor: Harnessing the destructive energies of forge worlds within their weaponry, certain Skitarii are so soaked in radiation that even to approach them is to confer a death sentence upon yourself. Victory for them is pyrrhic, as this radiation burns through even their heavy armour plate, slowly poisoning them to death even as their carbines bring about the (much quicker) demise of their enemies.
Rad-Saturation.modifiers:
<trait category="Debuff" icon="Actions/AdeptusMechanicus/RadSaturation" stacking="1">
	<perTurnModifiers endure="0">
		<modifier>
			<conditions>
				<unit>
					<enemy/>
					<noTrait name="Fortification"/>
					<noTrait name="Vehicle"/>
				</unit>
			</conditions>
			<effects>
				<weaponDamage weapon="RadSaturation"/>
			</effects>
		</modifier>
	</perTurnModifiers>
</trait>

Reclaimator Protocols.flavor: Nothing must be wasted—not a drop of food, not an watt of energy, not a scrap of flesh. Executions are minimised in favour of servitor conversions, prompting an increased vigour in all other activities…

Servo-Skull Uplink.flavor: It is a great honour for a pious Imperial servant or tech-adept to be converted into a servo skull after death—to have their skull augmented with anti-grav and a rudimentary machine intelligence. Optically-augmented servo skulls like those possessed by a Skitarii Marshal are useful for reconnaissance and targeting, hugely reducing the chance of wasted shots.

Shroudpsalm.flavor: Robot, servitor and priest shift their binharic emissions into the visible spectra, the static pouring from their vox-grilles manifesting as an electromagnetic storm that hides them from the foe.

Siphon Vigour.description: Killing an enemy unit increases the invulnerable damage reduction.
Siphon Vigour.flavor: They might be obsessed with wasting energy, but the Electro-Priests are no hypocrites. When an enemy dies to the blows of their electroleech staves, the protective Voltagheist field is invigorated with bio electric energy, repulsing even the strongest attacks.

Siphoned Vigour.flavor: They might be obsessed with wasting energy, but the Electro-Priests are no hypocrites. When an enemy dies to the blows of their electroleech staves, the protective Voltagheist field is invigorated with bio electric energy, repulsing even the strongest attacks.

Solar Reflectors.description: Increases the energy output for each building in an adjacent tile.
Solar Reflectors.flavor: Planning, planning, planning. The Adeptus Mechanicus Magi design each city so it works as a functioning whole, each part supporting the next. Solar reflectors on all structures direct the small amount of energy they capture through Gladius Prime’s storm systems to the nearest Thermo-Exchanger Shrine.

Soylens Acquisition Teams.description: Increases the food output for each building in an adjacent tile.
Soylens Acquisition Teams.flavor: The Reclaimators employ a small number of the undercity’s population in an unsavory role. These Soylens Acquisition Teams are better known as bodysnatchers and they aggressively hunt out the dead (or nearly dead) ensuring that any future rations always have the very freshest soylens protein…

Stygian Enlightenment.flavor: Some Tech-Priests are more open to studying Xenos technology than others. Only the Forge World of Stygies VIII consistently escapes punishment for these Xenarite tendencies, partly because of their world’s importance, partly because it cripples any attackers. Following their path is certainly a fast way to speed up access to forbidden technologies.

Terran Generalism.description: Increases the production output for each building in an adjacent tile.
Terran Generalism.flavor: Though many Forge Worlds have specialised towards particular needs and act as independent empires within the human sphere, it’s worth remembering that most Tech-Priests are generalists, loyally supporting the Imperium in its drive to the stars—and following the orders of Earth as much as Mars.

Triplex Necessity.description: Increases the minerals output for each building in an adjacent tile.
Triplex Necessity.flavor: Following new designs discovered on Triplex Phall, during the construction of new structures, care is taken to explore any subterranean areas and map out any potential ore veins. With a Haemotrope Reactor, its plasma can be directed down these prepared routes to more efficiently extract the ore.

Voltagheist Field.flavor: Nimbuses of pure energy surround all Electro-Priests, crackling from their bare skin tocoalesce into sparking pockets of electromagnetism that hover like will-o-the-wisps above a drowned corpse. When incoming projectiles or energy beams threaten an Electro-Priest these tiny voltaic ghosts will often intercede, shattering or dissipating the threats in puffs of burning ozone. When the wearer of the field charges the foe, those same voltagheists ground upon nearby enemies in bursts of electric force.

Voices in the Code.flavor: Closing with a Sicarian Infiltrator is a mistake—their augmented craniums broadcast a brutally disruptive audiovisual assault, causing enemies to fall deafened and blinded; battles are often decided before even a single kill is confirmed.

Wrath of Mars.flavor: None can smite the blasphemer like those from Mars, for theirs is the most righteous of zeal. All praise the glory of the Machine God!

Agile.description: Increases the movement, but decreases the attacks.

Ammo Runt.flavor: An ammo runt is a heavily overburdened Gretchin who carries extra ammunition for his master.

Amphibious.description: The unit can move over water and ignores the penalties of rivers.
Amphibious.flavor: Very few of the standard military vehicles of the 41st millenium are designed with amphibious assault in mind—to reduce weight by eliminating ammunition and armour is often seen as a step too far. However, the Imperial Chimera was designed many millennia ago to be the ultimate flexible light tank and is quite capable of fording rivers.

And They Shall Know No Fear.description: Reduces the morale loss and grants immunity to fear.
And They Shall Know No Fear.flavor: Some warriors refuse to surrender, fighting on whatever the odds.

Animosity.flavor: When the tides of Waaagh! flow, the Orks are visibly larger and stronger—but when the tides ebb, the Orks are weakened too.
Animosity.modifiers:
<trait category="Debuff" icon="Traits/Waaagh" rankMax="9">
	<modifiers>
		<modifier>
			<effects>
				<attacks mulMin="-0.02" mulMax="-0.20"/>
			</effects>
		</modifier>
		<modifier visible="0">
			<effects>
				<loyalty mulMin="-0.02" mulMax="-0.20"/>
			</effects>
		</modifier>
	</modifiers>
</trait>

Anti-Grav Upwash.description: Increases the movement when the health is above 66%.

Apocalyptic Barrage.description: Hits multiple group members of the target unit.
Apocalyptic Barrage.flavor: Blast weapons fire shells, missiles or packets of energy that explode on impact.

Apocalyptic Blast.description: Hits multiple group members of the target unit.
Apocalyptic Blast.flavor: Blast weapons fire shells, missiles or packets of energy that explode on impact.

Apocalyptic Mega-Blast.description: Hits multiple group members of the target unit.
Apocalyptic Mega-Blast.flavor: Blast weapons fire shells, missiles or packets of energy that explode on impact.

Armorium Cherub.flavor: Cherubim are diminutive flying cyborg constructs created to assist the Emperor's servants, be they scribe or soldier. Among the Adeptus Astartes they are rarely seen outside of the Librarius, save for those few that relay targeting data and carry spare ammunition for Devastator Squads.

Armourbane.flavor: This weapon has been crafted with one aim in mind: to pierce the hides of armoured vehicles.

Artefact.flavor: Over the millennia, something in the Old One structures dotting Gladius has attracted many races to this planet. They have brought with them objects with extraordinary powers, meaning the surface is littered with alien technologies of all sizes and kinds.

Assault Doctrine.flavor:
“Where there is uncertainty, I shall bring light
Where there is doubt, I shall sow faith.
Where there is shame, I shall point atonement.
Where there is rage, I shall show its course.
My word in the soul shall be as my bolter in the field.”
  — Litany of Devotion, traditional

Assault Vehicle.flavor: This vehicle is specifically designed to disgorge troops into the thick of the fray.

Improved Frag Casings.flavor: By using a more advanced engraving protocol on the casing, the lethality of explosive is much improved.

Kraken Bolts.flavor: An Astartes-derived upgrade to the standard bolter, this kit allows a bolter to fire Kraken penetrator rounds, hard-tipped projectiles with a heavier explosive charge. These heavier rounds are much favoured by the Space Marine Deathwatch alien hunters.

Substructure Extension.flavor: One day, this will be a Hive City—a billion people in one structure, towering over a poisoned world—but first, this settlement needs to expand a little, to set the foundations for the galaxies' biggest conurbations.

Substructure Supply Tunnels.flavor: The Departmento Munitorum might be inefficient, but they can plan and the Techpriest Explorators and Servitors can build. These bunkered tunnels allow the Astra Militarum commander to oversee a much larger city area, without losing defensive control.

Shoot Sharp and Scarper.flavor: What Ratlings lack militarily in, well, everything, they make up in knowing when it’s the right time to shoot and when it’s the right time to run.

Naval Orders.flavor: Edict, Departmento Munitorum: to all voidport overseers. Labourer sleep cycles are halved until further notice, production targets are raised. Arbitrators are being deployed to all sectors to ensure compliance.

Bulwark of the Emperor.flavor: Edict, Astra Militarum: to all General Staff, Regimental Commanders, Company Commanders. All units are to be kept under or behind protective cover at all times, even during R&R. Additional resource expenditure for defense repairs is authorised.

Running Hot.flavor: Edict, Departmento Munitorum: to all power unit overseers. Safeguards are to be removed on all plasma ionisers; the labour Corps has been mandated to replenish manpower depleted by resulting meltdowns without further authorisation.

Agronomic Surge.flavor: Edict, Departmento Munitorum: to all Imperial subjects. Personal rations are reduced with immediate effect. Arbitrators have been dispatched to farms, granaries and storehouses to ensure compliance.

Breeding Licenses.flavor: Edict, Departmento Munitorum: to all registered insula keepers. For the period of this Edict, connubial encounters are encouraged. Also, to all Imperial storehouse overseers. For the period of this Edict, anaphrodisiac dosages are to be eliminated from both the food and water supply.

Inspired Training.flavor: Edict, Astra Militarum: to all Commissars and recruitment officers. Volunteering sweeps are to be doubled, the Emperor's Mercy is to be applied to all recusants.

Hotshot Power Packs.flavor: These superior modular packs convert the standard lasgun into a 'Hellgun', with improved range and power, but reduced power pack capacity and degraded reliability, requiring constant maintenance. Even units that already have dedicated Hotshot lasguns benefit from more reliable Hotshot power pack supplies.

Propaganda Broadcast.flavor: Edict, Adeptus Arbites: to all Commissars, Arbitrators and Enforcers: a period of increased Imperial communication has been commissioned. During this time, insula-to-insula searches are now authorised in order to ensure maximum devotion to the Emperor. Chasteners are to apply the Lex Imperialis rigorously.

Extraction Quotas.flavor: Edict, Departmento Munitorum: to all manufactory overseers: servitors are required to be run continuously for this cycle. Burnouts / fatalities are to be replaced from the lower ranks of the penal and labour corps.

Coven Foci.flavor: Edict, Adeptus Astra Telepathica: to the Coven Masters and magisters of the Scholastia Psykana. Quality thresholds for recruitment have been lowered; summary executions should thus be minimal, blanks excepted. Assign all recruits to a Sanctioned Psyker immediately.

Revelations of the Omnissiah.flavor: Edict, Adeptus Mechanicus: to all Tech-Priests. During this cycle, the Quest for Knowledge takes precedence. Studies of STC designs, exploratory missions are to be encouraged. Praise the Omnissiah!

Rites of the Machine Spirits.flavor: Edict, Adeptus Mechanicus: to all Manufactorum Magi. Production quotas for this period are raised. Personal projects must be put on hold during this time. Additional resources / unguents will be provided for performance of the machine rites. Praise the Omnissiah!

Aversion to Light.description: Increases the damage taken from flame and melta weapons.
Aversion to Light.flavor: The horrors of the Umbra shard flourish at night, in the dark corners of Gladius. But bring a light to them and they shrink, the nightmares turning away. And bring a flamer to them…
Aversion to Light.modifiers:
<trait alwaysVisible="1" category="Debuff">
	<modifiers>
		<modifier>
			<conditions>
				<encounter>
					<opponent>
						<attacking/>
					</opponent>
					<weapon match="Any">
						<trait name="Flame"/>
						<trait name="Melta"/>
					</weapon>
				</encounter>
			</conditions>
			<effects>
				<damageTaken mul="1.0"/>
			</effects>
		</modifier>
	</modifiers>
</trait>

Barrage.description: Does not require line of sight, but cannot overwatch.
Barrage.flavor: Barrage weapons lob shells high into the air, landing them in the midst of the foe.

Beam.description: Hits with increased accuracy against multiple group members of the target unit.

Bike.flavor: Units mounted on Bikes excel at vanguard strikes. They are able to use their fast speed to strike deep into enemy territory, complete their mission and escape before an enemy is able to react. These warriors are often regarded as dangerously hot-headed risk-takers, but their effectiveness cannot be denied.

Bladestorm.description: Increases the damage and armour penetration.

Blast.description: Hits multiple group members of the target unit.
Blast.flavor: Blast weapons fire shells, missiles or packets of energy that explode on impact.

Blind.flavor: This attack looses a brilliant flare of light, searing the sight of the victim and forcing him to fight blind for a few moments.

Blinding.description: Reduces the accuracy of the target infantry or monstrous creature unit.
Blinding.modifiers:
<trait alwaysVisible="1" category="Buff">
	<onCombatOpponentModifiers>
		<modifier>
			<conditions>
				<encounter>
					<self>
						<attacking/>
					</self>
					<opponent>
						<noAttacking/>
						<noTrait name="Fortification"/>
						<noTrait name="Vehicle"/>
					</opponent>
				</encounter>
			</conditions>
			<effects>
				<addTrait name="Blind" duration="1"/>
			</effects>
		</modifier>
	</onCombatOpponentModifiers>
</trait>

Blood Blessing.flavor: Rising from the ground, the Skull Altar is formed out of the violent tributes heaped in offering for Khorne's Throne. From atop the grisly pedestal a priest of Khorne roars out invectives, evoking the judgements of the Blood God to smite down all signs of weakness.

Bolster Defences.flavor:
“Every position must be held to the last man: there must be no retirement. With our backs to the wall, and believing in the justice of our cause, each one of us must fight on to the end.”
  — Imperial Warmaster Solon

Bolt Weapon.flavor: The boltgun, or bolter, fires small missiles known as 'bolts'. Each self-propelled bolt explodes with devastating effect once it has penetrated its target. There are many variations of boltguns, from the short-barreled bolt pistol to the Vulcan mega-bolter often mounted on Titans and other super-heavy vehicles.

Bolter Drill.flavor:
“I believe in three tenets of battle—firepower, firepower, and more firepower.”
  — Kardan Stronos, Chapter Master of the Iron Hands

Bosspole.description: Reduces the morale loss based on the amount of allied units in the area.
Bosspole.flavor: Ork Nobz often sport a trophy pole that shows they are not to be messed with. A Nob with a Bosspole often finds it comes in handy when cracking heads to restore some order in the heat of battle.

Broken.description: Reduces the accuracy and increases the damage taken.

Brute Shield.description: Increases the damage and damage reduction.
Brute Shield.flavor: These shields resemble large and resilient energised bucklers. They are carried by some Bullgryns, serving equally well in combat as a defensive measure and handy bludgeon.

Bulky.description: Requires an additional cargo slot in a transport.
Bulky.flavor: This creature is so massive it takes up an inordinate amount of space in any vehicle or building it enters.

Camo Netting.flavor: Whether rare cameleoline netting or crude webbing woven with local flora, camo netting helps conceal a vehicle from prying eyes.

Capturable.description: The unit can be captured by another adjacent unit.

Ceramite Plating.flavor: These hull plates are thrice-blessed by the Chapter's Techmarines and anointed with the seven sacred unguents of thermic warding to protect against the extreme conditions of orbital re-entry. Such precautions also serve to thwart the fury of certain weapons, absorbing and dispersing even the most extreme temperatures and microwave emissions.

Arcane Occulum.description: Boon of Chaos that increases the accuracy.
Arcane Occulum.flavor: A blood-shot eye pushes through the flesh.

Daemonbone Casings.flavor: The Warpsmiths may have only trapped minor horrors in the casings of these explosive shells, but their rage at the point of impact isn’t minor—as they shatter and return to the warp, they rage and snatch at anything nearby.

Bloated.flavor: Though Nurgle’s cursed diseases rot a man both physically and spiritually, they also imbue their subjects decaying flesh with inhuman resilience. To such bloated forms, spreading their pox can often bring with it minor blessings from the plague God.

Blood Rage.description: Increases the melee attacks and movement.
Blood Rage.flavor: The Helbrute launches itself at nearby enemies, driving its cursed Dreadnought prison past its ancient safety limits into behaviour thoroughly daemonic.

Warpborne Bolts.flavor: Bridging the promethium-powered Inferno Bolts of the Imperium and the psychically-powered Inferno Bolts of the Thousand Sons Traitor Legion, Warpborne Bolt skip through the Warp to unleash superheated chemical fire upon their targets.

Call of the Dark Gods.flavor: The people of the Imperium will listen to any lies, believe any tale, which tells them that they’re not doomed. That way, sadly, lies perdition, and the gates of Chaos stand wide open to the lost and the damned—at least, on the way in.

Nexus of Doom.flavor: The worshippers of Chaos have shed their pretences. Where before they drew souls to them by their weaknesses or by daemon seduction, now they do it by whips and chains. Packs of slavers and warbands hunt their city’s hinterland for lives to sacrifice. Only the strongest can escape their reach; the weak are grist to the mill for Chaos.

Crazed.description: If the unit was damaged in the previous turn, it gains one of the following traits at random for one turn: Fire Frenzy, Rising Fury, Blood Rage.
Crazed.flavor: All Helbrutes are psychotic and dangerous monstrosities—a veteran of the Long War driven insane by tortured entombment. So attacking a Helbrute might seem rational, but if you fail to destroy it outright, you will only make it angrier and crazier.

Champion of Chaos.description: Killing an enemy unit may reward this unit with an unlocked Boon of Chaos or transform non-heroes into a Chaos Spawn or Daemon Prince.
Champion of Chaos.flavor: It is not unusual for the Chaos powers to bestow strange boons and mutations upon those who kill in their name. Not all of these boons are beneficial—the dark ones are as fickle as they are inscrutable, and even their most ardent followers are little more than pawns in a celestial game.

Crystalline Body.description: Boon of Chaos that increases the hitpoints.
Crystalline Body.flavor: The champion's flesh changes to diamond.

Cultist Sacrifice.flavor: So fervent are the cultists of Chaos but so weak their martial prowess, that the gods enjoy their demise as much as their life—more so, perhaps, given the blessings they bestow at their sacrifice.
Cultist Sacrifice.modifiers:
<trait category="Buff" icon="Actions/ChaosSpaceMarines/CultistSacrifice" visibilityCategory="Building">
	<modifiers>
		<modifier>
			<conditions>
				<building>
					<type name="ChaosSpaceMarines/Headquarters"/>
				</building>
			</conditions>
			<effects>
				<growth mul="0.5"/>
			</effects>
		</modifier>
		<modifier requiredUpgrade="ChaosSpaceMarines/OurLivesForTheGods">
			<conditions>
				<building>
					<type name="ChaosSpaceMarines/Headquarters"/>
				</building>
			</conditions>
			<effects>
				<growth mul="0.25"/>
			</effects>
		</modifier>
	</modifiers>
</trait>

Daemonforge.description: Increases the damage and armour penetration.
Daemonforge.flavor: The Daemon Engines of the Chaos Space Marines are driven by a fathomless hatred born of the warp.

Dark Glory.flavor: Some champions of Chaos are so blessed by their patron deity that they are supernaturally protected from harm. They might be surrounded by a powerful, crackling shield of energy, or else bullets aimed at them may be strangely turned aside just before they strike. In either case, it is clear that the Dark Gods are watching over them.

Devourer of Souls.description: Restores hitpoints each turn and each time this unit kills an enemy unit.
Devourer of Souls.flavor: Venomcrawlers are perhaps the most sophisticated works of the Warpsmith, spider-like Daemon Engines that crave empyric energy and will consume other daemonic entities to get it—or even the living.

Dirge Caster.description: Prevents the unit from doing overwatch attacks.
Dirge Caster.flavor: This device emits a series of terrifying wails, screams and howls that demoralise and confuse enemies who hear them.

Fire Frenzy.description: Reduces movement and increases the ranged attacks.
Fire Frenzy.flavor: In response to the pitiful fire of mortals, the Hellbrute unloads its weapons relentlessly, blind to anything but the deafening roar of its daemonic ammunition.

Deferred Absolution.flavor: The bowed figures of the Dark Disciples incessantly shriek the names of the Chaos Gods, calling for their protection. Typically fickle, the Gods are prone to bless those nearby instead, leaving the desperate Disciples as frail as ever.

Gift of Mutation.description: At the start of the next turn, the unit gains a new random unlocked Boon of Chaos and this trait ends.
Gift of Mutation.flavor: The Dark Gods have granted their champion a malign reward, which is as likely to be a razor-sharp appendage as it is to be an inconveniently placed tongue.

Grasping Pseudopods.flavor: From the spawn’s twisting form come meaty tentacles, flailing and gibbering at nearby opponents. Come too close and they reflexively wrap themselves around a target, drawing it to whatever maws and teeth the spawn currently has.

Ichor Blood.description: Enemies take damage when they cause melee damage.
Ichor Blood.flavor: It is not blood that runs through this champion's veins, but searing ichor, molten brass, psychadelic narcotics, virulent pus or some such vile and deadly substance.
Ichor Blood.modifiers:
<trait alwaysVisible="1" category="Buff" icon="Actions/ChaosSpaceMarines/IchorBlood" rankMax="2">
	<modifiers>
		<modifier>
			<conditions>
				<weapon>
					<trait name="Melee"/>
				</weapon>
			</conditions>
			<effects>
				<damageReturnFactor addMin="1.0" addMax="3.0"/>
			</effects>
		</modifier>
	</modifiers>
</trait>

Icon of Despair.description: Increases the melee damage reduction when attacked by fearful enemies.
Icon of Despair.flavor: This icon is surrounded by a miasma of disease and hopelessness, turning the thoughts of any nearby foes to the grisly and inevitable deaths that await them.
Icon of Despair.modifiers:
<trait alwaysVisible="1" category="Buff" icon="Actions/ChaosSpaceMarines/IconOfDespair">
	<modifiers>
		<modifier>
			<conditions>
				<encounter>
					<opponent>
						<noTrait name="Fearless"/>
						<noTrait name="Eldar/KhaineAwakened"/>
						<noTrait name="Tyranids/SynapseLink"/>
						<noTrait name="Zealot"/>
					</opponent>
				</encounter>
			</conditions>
			<effects>
				<meleeDamageReduction add="0.5"/>
			</effects>
		</modifier>
	</modifiers>
</trait>

Icon of Excess.flavor: Depravity hangs about this icon like cloying musk, driving those below it into an orgy of sensation-seeking that can only be halted by the total destruction of their bodies.

Icon of Wrath.flavor: The red-hot curses of the Blood God resound in the minds of those in the shadow of this icon, compelling them to hurl themselves into the fray with wild abandon.

Infernal Industry.description: Increases the energy and ore output.
Infernal Industry.flavor: A Warpsmith is an unparalleled master of technology, without the ethical or historical constraints of their erstwhile peers in the Mechanicum. If they can increase a facility’s functioning at the cost of a few hundred lives, they will.

Infernal Power.flavor: The fell power of the immaterium flows from the psyker, imbuing the Daemons that reside within his followers' bodies with even greater ferocity.
Infernal Power.modifiers:
<trait category="Buff" icon="Actions/ChaosSpaceMarines/InfernalPower" rankMax="2">
	<modifiers>
		<modifier>
			<conditions>
				<unit>
					<allied/>
					<faction name="ChaosSpaceMarines"/>
				</unit>
			</conditions>
			<effects>
				<accuracy mulMin="0.1" mulMax="0.3"/>
				<damage mulMin="0.1" mulMax="0.3"/>
			</effects>
		</modifier>
	</modifiers>
</trait>

Forbidden Energies.flavor: Going beyond the Imperium’s proscribed technologies has allowed the Dark Mechanicum to unlock more lethal and more horrifying weapon capabilities.

Lasher Tendrils.flavor: These metallic tendrils entrap their prey in an iron grip.

Loathsome Aura.flavor: A brutal edifice, raised up to destabilise local reality by the forces of Chaos, the Noctilith Crown brings the Warp closer, empowering those attuned to the Dark Gods.

Malevolent Locus.flavor: By this twisted construct, the whispers of the Warp are amplified, assaulting the minds of enemy psykers constantly. Few emerge unscathed from the trial.

Malicious Volleys.description: If the unit remains stationary, they fire Rapid Fire weapons with increased attacks at all ranges.
Malicious Volleys.flavor: To a Heretic Astartes the boltgun is far more than a weapon, it is an instrument of his anger and the bringer of death to his foes.
Malicious Volleys.modifiers:
<trait alwaysVisible="1" category="Buff" icon="Traits/RapidFire">
	<modifiers>
		<modifier>
			<conditions>
				<unit>
					<notMovedThisTurn/>
				</unit>
				<weapon>
					<trait name="RapidFire"/>
				</weapon>
				<encounterRange greater="1"/>
			</conditions>
			<effects>
				<rangedAttacks mul="1"/>
			</effects>
		</modifier>
	</modifiers>
</trait>

Mark of Khorne.flavor: The Mark of Khorne is bestowed only upon those whose relentless rage and boundless ferocity pays due homage to the Blood Good's own. To such disciples, Khorne grants an unholy wrath that burns as hot as the stars.

Mark of Nurgle.flavor: Nurgle's blessing manifests not only as a suite of virulent plagues and diseases, but also as the inhuman constitution needed to survive them.

Mark of Slaanesh.flavor: The devotees of Slaanesh have their senses and reactions heightened to a supernatural degree, all the better to drink in the extreme, multifaceted stimuli of the battlefield. A warrior gifted in this manner will move with uncanny grace and speed, his blade lashing out like the tongue of a serpent as he revels in the ugly spectacle of death.

Mark of Tzeentch.flavor: Those dedicated to Tzeentch enjoy the protection and prescience of the Master of Manipulation.

Mechanoid.description: Boon of Chaos that increases the armour.
Mechanoid.flavor: The champion's flesh bonds with his armour.

Conjoined Weaponry.flavor: It’s normal for soldiers to grow close to a trusted weapon—but the marines of the Traitor Legions have gone further. Over the centuries, the troops of the Adeptus Astartes have literally grown into their weaponry, becoming one with their guns and blades, exponentially increasing their effectiveness.

Multi-legged Terror.flavor: The titanic weight of the iron and brass that make up the non-Empyrean parts of the Brass Scorpion rests on six lethally sharp limbs. When it scuttles forward with unexpected, groundshattering speed, it easily trample any smaller foe.

Mutated Beyond Reason.description: At the start of each turn, the unit gains one of the following random mutations for one turn: Grasping Pseudopods, Subcutaneous Armour, Toxic Haemorrhage.
Mutated Beyond Reason.flavor: When they fall from their god’s favour, Chaos worshippers are blessed and cursed in equal measure, turning into the foul Chaos Spawn—writhing masses of mutation, endlessly sprouting new features at their god’s whim.

Possession.description: Killing enemy units transforms them into allied Chaos Spawns.
Possession.flavor: The psyker blasts away their enemy's soul so that the spiritless shell left behind can be possessed by a Daemon, who quickly transforms it into a more pleasing form.
Possession.modifiers:
<trait alwaysVisible="1" category="Buff" icon="Actions/ChaosSpaceMarines/Possession" rankMax="2">
	<onEnemyKilledOpponentTileModifiers>
		<modifier>
			<conditions>
				<encounter>
					<opponent>
						<noTrait name="IronWill"/>
					</opponent>
					<opponentTile>
						<land/>
					</opponentTile>
				</encounter>
			</conditions>
			<effects>
				<addUnit name="ChaosSpaceMarines/ChaosSpawn"/>
			</effects>
		</modifier>
	</onEnemyKilledOpponentTileModifiers>
	<onEnemyKilledSelfModifiers>
		<modifier>
			<conditions>
				<encounter>
					<opponent>
						<noTrait name="IronWill"/>
					</opponent>
					<opponentTile>
						<land/>
					</opponentTile>
				</encounter>
			</conditions>
			<effects>
				<processUse action="ChaosSpaceMarines/Possession"/>
			</effects>
		</modifier>
	</onEnemyKilledSelfModifiers>
</trait>

Prince of Chaos.flavor: Little else could more inspire a warrior of Chaos than to see a Daemon Prince—once a mortal just like them, now nearer to a God—fighting alongside them.

Reservoir of Daemonic Energy.flavor: Venomcrawlers are uniquely valued both off and on the battlefield. Not only can their repositories of stored warp energy be siphoned in order to create fresh Daemon Engines, but they can be used in the thick of combat to weaken the fabric of reality. Masters of Possession are particularly adept at drawing upon this reservoir to lure the daemonic servants of the Chaos Gods into existence. At battle's end these Daemons are hastily consumed by the Venomcrawler, their essences used to replenish its depleted warp stores.

Rite of Blood.flavor: Khorne may have other, minor, traits—a certain nobility and simplicity of war—but his lust for death and blood outweighs them by far. Rites in his name bring not only his blessing, but also increase the work rate of the slave populace, in their terror that they could be next.
Rite of Blood.modifiers:
<trait category="Buff" visibilityCategory="Building" icon="Actions/ChaosSpaceMarines/RiteOfBlood">
	<modifiers>
		<modifier>
			<conditions>
				<building match="Any">
					<type name="ChaosSpaceMarines/Aircraft"/>
					<type name="ChaosSpaceMarines/Cult"/>
					<type name="ChaosSpaceMarines/Heroes"/>
					<type name="ChaosSpaceMarines/Infantry"/>
					<type name="ChaosSpaceMarines/Vehicles"/>
				</building>
			</conditions>
			<effects>
				<production mul="0.33"/>
			</effects>
		</modifier>
	</modifiers>
</trait>

Rite of Change.description: Increases the production and research output.
Rite of Change.flavor: Invoking the Changer’s name is highly risky—few know what he will do to further his endless plans, or the curses he brings if he is distracted to no purpose. After a Rite of Change, some mutate, some disappear, some are embedded alive into the city walls—but always something is learned.
Rite of Change.modifiers:
<trait category="Buff" visibilityCategory="Building" icon="Actions/ChaosSpaceMarines/RiteOfChange">
	<modifiers>
		<modifier>
			<conditions>
				<building>
					<type name="ChaosSpaceMarines/Construction"/>
				</building>
			</conditions>
			<effects>
				<production mul="0.33"/>
			</effects>
		</modifier>
		<modifier>
			<conditions>
				<building>
					<type name="ChaosSpaceMarines/Research"/>
				</building>
			</conditions>
			<effects>
				<research mul="0.33"/>
			</effects>
		</modifier>
	</modifiers>
</trait>

Rite of Pestilence.description: Increases the food output and growth rate.
Rite of Pestilence.flavor: A Rite of Pestilence doesn’t explicitly sacrifice to Nurgle—it merely invites his blessing upon your people. Given the virulence of Nurgle’s diseases—the Rot, the Chortling Murrain, the Oozing Pox—many will die of these blessings, in his name. Many others will live with them and burgeon with plague-ridden fecundity.
Rite of Pestilence.modifiers:
<trait category="Buff" visibilityCategory="Building" icon="Actions/ChaosSpaceMarines/RiteOfPestilence">
	<modifiers>
		<modifier>
			<conditions>
				<building>
					<type name="ChaosSpaceMarines/Food"/>
				</building>
			</conditions>
			<effects>
				<food mul="0.33"/>
			</effects>
		</modifier>
		<modifier>
			<conditions>
				<building>
					<type name="ChaosSpaceMarines/Headquarters"/>
				</building>
			</conditions>
			<effects>
				<growth mul="0.33"/>
			</effects>
		</modifier>
	</modifiers>
</trait>

Rite of Unholy Pleasure.description: Increases the influence and loyalty output.
Rite of Unholy Pleasure.flavor: Stop your ears with wax, bind your mouth, stitch up your eyes, and tie yourself down. Only then invoke Slaanesh, so that you may not succumb utterly to the Pleasure God’s irresistible desires.
Rite of Unholy Pleasure.modifiers:
<trait category="Buff" visibilityCategory="Building" icon="Actions/ChaosSpaceMarines/RiteOfUnholyPleasure">
	<modifiers>
		<modifier>
			<conditions>
				<building>
					<type name="ChaosSpaceMarines/Influence"/>
				</building>
			</conditions>
			<effects>
				<influence mul="0.33"/>
			</effects>
		</modifier>
		<modifier>
			<conditions>
				<building>
					<type name="ChaosSpaceMarines/Loyalty"/>
				</building>
			</conditions>
			<effects>
				<loyalty mul="0.33"/>
			</effects>
		</modifier>
	</modifiers>
</trait>

Rising Fury.flavor: The Helbrute’s rage overtakes it, throwing it into a frenzy of blows against anything nearby.

Runes of the Blood God.flavor: Inscribed on the Brass Scorpion by the adepts of the Dark Mechanicum are shimmering runes, dancing like flames, writhing on the surface. Psykers foolish enough to attempt an assault will find their minds seared by Khorne’s eternal rage.

Shatter Defences.flavor: Whatever cover the enemy cowers behind, a Warpsmith can draw upon millennia of siege experience to advise on the best way to bypass or to destroy them.

Siege Crawler.description: Increases the armour penetration against fortifications.
Siege Crawler.flavor: Maulerfiends lack ranged weapons of any kind, unusual for a vehicle of their size. Yet their agility and their various cutting weapons mean that they are a huge threat to static fortifications, able to explore them, find a weak spot, and exploit it.

Subcutaneous Armour.flavor: Space Marine armour, even as old as that owned by the Traitor Legions, integrates with the unique Black Carapace interface of an Adeptus Astartes. But over the millenia, many Chaos Space Marines have become one with their armour, with the Black Carapace extending throughout their flesh and bones.

Temporal Distortion.description: Boon of Chaos that increases the movement.
Temporal Distortion.flavor: Time is altered around the champion.

Toxic Haemorrhage.description: Increases the damage against infantry and monstrous creature units.
Toxic Haemorrhage.flavor: Spurting vile vapours and heinous fluids, the Chaos Spawn’s cursed innards could spell the death of a less-blessed creature.

Veterans of the Long War.description: Reduces the morale loss, and increases the melee accuracy against units of the Space Marines faction.
Veterans of the Long War.flavor: Many Chaos Space Marine factions have been locked in a constant, grinding war against the Imperium of Man for centuries, if not millennia. The burning hate they feel for their loyalist brothers has had time to fester, now eclipsing all other emotions. This applies, above all, to the original nine Traitor Legions who flocked to Horus' banner ten millennia ago and continue their war against their loyal brethren to this day.

Warp Frenzy.description: Boon of Chaos that increases the attacks.
Warp Frenzy.flavor: The champion is consumed with anger.

Worthy Offering.description: Increases the chance that this unit and adjacent allied Champions of Chaos receive a Boon of Chaos.
Worthy Offering.flavor: Having the eye of the gods upon you means those nearby are also subject to greater scrutiny—whether that turns them to Spawn or Daemon Prince, depends on how well they perform and the inscrutable whim of the Gods.

Chapter Unity.flavor: The relics housed in the Great Hall remind the Adeptus Astartes of the heroes of the past, and that one day their armour, weapons and bones could also be revered here.

City.description: Increases the damage reduction and the healing rate for allied units. Decreases the movement cost of units. Increases the ranged damage reduction of infantry units.
City.modifiers:
<trait category="Buff">
	<modifiers>
		<modifier>
			<conditions>
				<unit>
					<allied/>
				</unit>
			</conditions>
			<effects>
				<cityDamageReduction add="0.33"/>
				<healingRate mul="1.0"/>
			</effects>
		</modifier>
		<modifier>
			<conditions>
				<tile>
					<noFeatureCategory name="WireWeed"/>
				</tile>
			</conditions>
			<effects>
				<movementCost max="1"/>
			</effects>
		</modifier>
		<modifier requiredUpgrade="Necrons/CityDefenseBonus">
			<conditions>
				<unit>
					<allied/>
				</unit>
			</conditions>
			<effects>
				<cityDamageReduction add="0.08"/>
			</effects>
		</modifier>
		<modifier>
			<conditions>
				<unit>
					<noTrait name="Flyer"/>
					<noTrait name="Fortification"/>
					<noTrait name="MonstrousCreature"/>
					<noTrait name="Vehicle"/>
				</unit>
			</conditions>
			<effects>
				<rangedDamageReduction add="0.33"/>
			</effects>
		</modifier>
	</modifiers>
</trait>

Cluster Mines.description: Deals damage upon entering the tile.
Cluster Mines.flavor: While operating behind enemy lines, Scout Bikers carry cluster mines—explosive devices crammed with tiny anti-personnel bomblets and triggered by tripwires or pressure sensors.
Cluster Mines.modifiers:
<trait category="Debuff" icon="Weapons/ClusterMines">
	<modifiers>
		<modifier>
			<conditions>
				<unit>
					<enemy/>
					<noTrait name="Flyer"/>
					<noTrait name="Necrons/ImmuneToNaturalLaw"/>
					<noTrait name="JetPack"/>
					<noTrait name="Jetbike"/>
					<noTrait name="Skimmer"/>
				</unit>
			</conditions>
			<effects>
				<movementCost min="100"/>
			</effects>
		</modifier>
	</modifiers>
	<onTileEnteredModifiers>
		<modifier>
			<conditions>
				<unit>
					<enemy/>
				</unit>
			</conditions>
			<effects>
				<weaponDamage weapon="ClusterMines"/>
				<removeFeature name="ClusterMines"/>
			</effects>
		</modifier>
	</onTileEnteredModifiers>
</trait>

Combat Shield.flavor: A combat shield is a lighter version of the storm shield fitted to the wearer's vambrace, leaving their hand free to wield another weapon whilst providing protection from incoming attacks.

Concussive.description: Temporarily reduces the accuracy of the target infantry or monstrous creature unit.
Concussive.flavor: Some weapons are designed to leave any foe that manages to survive their strike disoriented and easy to slay.
Concussive.modifiers:
<trait alwaysVisible="1" category="Buff">
	<onCombatOpponentModifiers>
		<modifier>
			<conditions>
				<encounter>
					<self>
						<attacking/>
					</self>
					<opponent>
						<noAttacking/>
						<noTrait name="Fortification"/>
						<noTrait name="Vehicle"/>
					</opponent>
				</encounter>
			</conditions>
			<effects>
				<addTrait name="Concussion" duration="1"/>
			</effects>
		</modifier>
	</onCombatOpponentModifiers>
</trait>

Convergent Targeting.description: Increases the accuracy when adjacent to an allied Thunderfire Cannon.

Cult Ambush.description: Increases the accuracy of overwatch attacks.
Cult Ambush.flavor: Genestealer Cults plan meticulously before each strike, their strategies honed to give every advantage when they rise up as one.

Curse of the Walking Pox.description: Converts damage into healing for this unit.
Curse of the Walking Pox.flavor: The rictus grin adorning each Poxwalker belies the torment their souls are in, trapped inside their mutated, dead bodies that fight on for Nurgle, infecting more innocents with the Walking Plague as they go.
Curse of the Walking Pox.modifiers:
<trait alwaysVisible="1">
	<modifiers>
		<modifier>
			<conditions>
				<encounter>
					<opponent match="Any">
						<noTrait name="Fortification"/>
						<noTrait name="Vehicle"/>
						<noTrait name="MonstrousCreature"/>
					</opponent>
				</encounter>
			</conditions>
			<effects>
				<lifeStealFactor add="0.83"/>
			</effects>
		</modifier>
	</modifiers>
</trait>

Daemon.flavor: The creatures of the Warp are many and foul, with infinite variety, but there are some characteristics that they all share.

Deathshriek.flavor: At the point of an Umbra’s death, all those around it receive a vision—of the long ago creature that was torn asunder and cast into the Warp, whilst a voice, horrifying and alluring, whispers a curse… “LINGER…”

Deeds of Glory.description: When gaining experience from combat the chapter gains influence.

Devastator Doctrine.flavor:
“Victory often rests on the correct weaponry being in the right place and at the right time. Even the most destructive weapons of war are worthless if absent from the battle.”
  — Artor Amhrad, Chapter Master of the Astral Knights

Discipline.flavor: Should discipline or morale falter, it is the task of the Commissar to take whatever steps necessary to restore order, and to do so in the absolute knowledge that his actions are just. Under the steely gaze of such a man, Imperial Guardsmen must be inspired to deeds they never believed possible.
Discipline.modifiers:
<trait category="Buff" rankMax="2">
	<modifiers>
		<modifier>
			<conditions>
				<unit>
					<allied/>
					<faction name="AstraMilitarum"/>
					<noTrait name="Fortification"/>
					<noTrait name="MonstrousCreature"/>
					<noTrait name="Vehicle"/>
				</unit>
			</conditions>
			<effects>
				<accuracy addMin="1" addMax="3"/>
			</effects>
		</modifier>
	</modifiers>
</trait>

Distort Scythe.flavor: The most dangerous of all Aeldari weapons enable their user to open a portal to the Warp. Often called D-weapons, these technological terrors collapse an area of the material universe. Whether the rift is localised or dispersed, the result is invariably fatal for those nearby.

Dogma Astartes.description: Increases the loyalty output of the fortress-city.
Dogma Astartes.flavor: The Chaplains of the Space Marines are grim spiritual guardians, whose first duty is to be ever watchful for the dangers of pride, doubt and heresy. Daunting even to their own brethren, Chaplains rely on dogma and liturgy to keep their brothers from spiritual corruption.

Dozer Blade.description: Reduces the movement penalty in forests and imperial ruins.
Dozer Blade.flavor: Dozer blades are heavy ploughs, blades, rams, or scoops, used to clear obstacles from the vehicle's path.

Ancient Evil.flavor: So long has this Warlord lived, steeped in horror and cruelty, that he is now shrouded in a malefic aura that augments the suffering from his and his army’s attacks.

Deviant Designs.flavor: The weaponmasters of the Kabalite foundries possess access to weapon variants normally considered impossible or totally unethical. Which, of course, is simply a question about how much a particular Archon is willing to pay to get them.

Betrayal Culture.description: Drukhari cities have lower loyalty by default. They get additional loyalty as they gather Influence.
Betrayal Culture.flavor: To the depraved Drukhari, it seems normal for a child betraying their parents into an eternity of torture just for the merest inkling of advantage. There is no trust in a Drukhari city, only power. The more powerful you are, the more will flock to your side.

Targetted Assassinations.description: Increases the loyalty of Drukhari cities.
Targetted Assassinations.flavor: Increases the loyalty of Drukhari cities.

Blade Artists.description: Increases the armour penetration in melee.
Blade Artists.flavor: Every denizen of Commorragh learns from a young age the value of blades, and all are adept in their usage, whether those wielded by their cruel hands or as part of their razor-edged armour.

Blade Whip.flavor: Only the Lacerai about the Wych cults regularly utilise the segmented blade known as a Razorflail, but their ability with it is legendary. Attacks that seem certain to miss curve to connect, shifting between whips and blades at will.

Blood Dancer.flavor: A star of the Commorrite arenas, the Succubi excel at close quarters combat. The skills they display before the baying crowds on the blood-soaked sands of the arena floor come in equally useful on the battlefield.
Blood Dancer.modifiers:
<trait alwaysVisible="1" category="Buff" icon="Actions/Drukhari/BloodDancer" rankMax="2">
	<modifiers>
		<modifier>
			<effects>
				<meleeAccuracy addMin="2" addMax="6"/>
			</effects>
		</modifier>
	</modifiers>
</trait>

Archon\u2019s Inspection.flavor: It is not as if the Drukhari’s indentured servants ever slacken in their labours. Yet when an Archon turns his gaze upon them, they labour harder, inhumanly so, knowing that a moment’s displeasure will lead to many lifetimes of impossible torment.
Archon\u2019s Inspection.modifiers:
<trait alwaysVisible="1" icon="Actions/Drukhari/BonusResources" category="Buff" visibilityCategory="Tile">
	<modifiers>
		<modifier>
			<conditions>
				<building>
					<noTrait name="Headquarters"/>
				</building>
			</conditions>
			<effects>
				<production mul="0.17"/>
				<food mul="0.33"/>
				<ore mul="0.33"/>
				<energy mul="0.33"/>
				<research mul="0.33"/>
				<influence mul="0.33"/>
				<loyalty mul="0.33"/>
			</effects>
		</modifier>
	</modifiers>
</trait>

Brides of Death.flavor: A succubus isn’t just impossibly perfect in appearance, combat and sadism—she also co-ordinates her Wych Cult and other Drukhari impeccably on the battlefield, a choreographer of torment.
Brides of Death.modifiers:
<trait category="Buff" icon="Actions/Drukhari/BridesOfDeath" rankMax="2">
	<modifiers>
		<modifier>
			<conditions>
				<unit>
					<allied/>
					<faction name="Drukhari"/>
				</unit>
				<weapon>
					<trait name="Melee"/>
				</weapon>
			</conditions>
			<effects>
				<meleeDamage mulMin="0.17" mulMax="0.5"/>
			</effects>
		</modifier>
	</modifiers>
</trait>

Swollen With Sin.flavor: As the Drukhari raiders become accustomed to a planet, their raiding base spreads out more widely, attracting more of the vilest residents of the galaxy, and able to support a larger population of the vile inheritors to the Aeldari. The slums and torture gardens of the city spread further outwards and downwards…

Domain Of Despair.flavor: So wealthy have the Archons and Dracons of this pirate realm become that they have established palaces for themselves here, knowing full well that they cannot stay, lest She Who Thirsts consume their souls completely. Of course, whilst they are here, they need a constant supply of captives to slake their inhuman lusts and stave off the rotting of their souls.

Combat Drugs.flavor: Though they drastically shorten the life expectancy of the user, chemical stimulants are widely used to heighten combat performance.
Combat Drugs.modifiers:
<trait category="Buff" icon="Actions/Drukhari/CombatDrugs">
	<modifiers>
		<modifier>
			<effects>
				<attacks mul="0.33"/>
			</effects>
		</modifier>
		<modifier visible="1" requiredUpgrade="Drukhari/Splintermind">
			<effects>
				<moraleLossFactor add="-0.33"/>
			</effects>
		</modifier>
		<modifier visible="1" requiredUpgrade="Drukhari/GraveLotus">
			<effects>
				<circumstanceMeleeDamage mul="0.50"/>
			</effects>
		</modifier>
		<modifier visible="1" requiredUpgrade="Drukhari/Painbringer">
			<effects>
				<feelNoPainDamageReduction add="0.33"/>
			</effects>
		</modifier>
	</modifiers>
</trait>

Corsair Outposts.description: Drukhari cities have lower growth by default. Controlled outposts grant additional growth.
Corsair Outposts.flavor: Though these townships appear like cities to the herd races, the Drukhari will not remain in them long unless they know there is wealth to be found nearby. But more successful raiding bases will attract more Drukhari, keen to get their share of the murder and pain.

				<growth mul="0.3"/>
			</effects>
		</modifier>
		<modifier visible="0">
			<conditions>
				<player>
					<outposts equal="17"/>
				</player>
				<building match="Any">
					<type name="Drukhari/Headquarters"/>
					<growth greater="0"/>
				</building>
			</conditions>
			<effects>
				<growth mul="0.35"/>
			</effects>
		</modifier>
		<modifier visible="0">
			<conditions>
				<player>
					<outposts equal="18"/>
				</player>
				<building match="Any">
					<type name="Drukhari/Headquarters"/>
					<growth greater="0"/>
				</building>
			</conditions>
			<effects>
				<growth mul="0.4"/>
			</effects>
		</modifier>
		<modifier visible="0">
			<conditions>
				<player>
					<outposts equal="19"/>
				</player>
				<building match="Any">
					<type name="Drukhari/Headquarters"/>
					<growth greater="0"/>
				</building>
			</conditions>
			<effects>
				<growth mul="0.45"/>
			</effects>
		</modifier>
		<modifier visible="0">
			<conditions>
				<player>
					<outposts greater="19"/>
				</player>
				<building match="Any">
					<type name="Drukhari/Headquarters"/>
					<growth greater="0"/>
				</building>
			</conditions>
			<effects>
				<growth mul="0.5"/>
			</effects>
		</modifier>
	</modifiers>
</trait>

A Soul Rush.description: Increases the growth by default of Drukhari cities.
A Soul Rush.flavor: Increases the growth by default of Drukhari cities.

Dodge.flavor: The diverse warriors – known as Hekatarii – within the Wych Cults wield a wildly divergent array of exotic tools to maim, entrap, slash and skewer. They wear little in the way of armour; their defence is their speed and agility, displaying their arrogance as they dodge the clumsy blows of the foe.

Relaxed Ilmaea Manifolds.flavor: This power station is only accessing the tiniest fraction of the power of one of the Drukhari’s Ilmaea—the captured Black Suns that ring Commorragh. Relaxing the safety manifolds just a touch boosts the power commensurately—as well as massively increasing the chance the Ilmaea errs and consumes Gladius Prime in a gulp. That’s a risk the near-immortal Drukhari are happy to take.

Enhanced Aethersails.flavor: Aethersails are used to capture the aetheric winds that flow out from open webway portals. Many vehicle crews are meticulous in the construction of these sails, incorporating frictionless alloys, vibro-pods and angled booms to enhance their bursts of speed.

Flickerfield.flavor: Flickerfields are highly advanced optical force shields that make the vehicle they are fitted to appear to flicker in and out of reality.

Ghostplate Armour.flavor: Those Drukhari who desire a substantial amount of protection whilst retaining a high degree of mobility wear armour made from hardened resins and shot through with pockets of lighter-than-air gas. Ghostplate armour also incorporates minor forcefield technology the better to protect its wearer.

Grisly Trophies.flavor: Some Drukhari vehicles are adorned with the disembodied heads of slain foes and daubed with copious amounts of enemy blood. The sight of the festering remains of once proud foes instils the Drukhari with arrogant pride.

Equipoise Ordnance.flavor: “Do not hope for a new day, little mortals. The Drukhari have you now and our grip is unshakeable. I assure you, all you will know now is eternal night—and eternal torment.” – Gyrthineus Roche, Archon of The Last Blade

Master of Pain.description: Grants additional feel no pain damage reduction.
Master of Pain.flavor: Such exquisite agonies are inflicted by a Haemonculus on its followers that they barely feel their own suffering any more, as oblivious as a follower of Nurgle to the wounds inflicted on their bodies.
Master of Pain.modifiers:
<trait category="Buff" icon="Actions/Drukhari/MasterOfPain" rankMax="2">
	<modifiers>
		<modifier>
			<conditions>
				<unit>
					<allied/>
					<faction name="Drukhari"/>
					<noTrait name="Vehicle"/>
					<noTrait name="Fortification"/>
				</unit>
			</conditions>
			<effects>
				<feelNoPainDamageReduction addMin="0.08" addMax="0.25"/>
			</effects>
		</modifier>
	</modifiers>
</trait>

Blade Aesthetics, Perfected.flavor: “Pain is the only universal constant. Pain is all. It is the key to creation and destruction both. Thus does he who masters pain become a god.” – Urien Rakarth, Master of the Haemonculi

Night Shields.flavor: The vehicle is covered by a broad-spectrum displacement field, enveloping it in cold and inky darkness. Foes find the vehicle hard to target, hidden as it is within a cloak of roiling shadow.

No Escape.description: Increases the attacks against open-topped units.

Overlord.flavor: “I understand your desire, my pets. I understand you wish to increase suffering and pain, so you prolong the moment. For now, though, I require merely death. Focus on that—later, there will be more to kill.” — Gyrthineus Roche, Archon of The Last Blade
Overlord.modifiers:
<trait category="Buff" icon="Actions/Drukhari/Overlord" rankMax="2">
	<modifiers>
		<modifier>
			<conditions>
				<unit>
					<allied/>
					<faction name="Drukhari"/>
				</unit>
			</conditions>
			<effects>
				<accuracy addMin="0.5" addMax="1.5"/>
			</effects>
		</modifier>
	</modifiers>
</trait>

Power from Pain.description: Grants combat bonuses as the unit levels up. Increases damage reduction at and above level 3, increases melee damage at and above level 6 and reduces the morale loss at level 10.
Power from Pain.flavor: As Drukhari feed on the souls of their foes, they become imbued with supernatural might, eventually turning into killing machines.
Power from Pain.modifiers:
<trait category="Buff" alwaysVisible="1">
	<modifiers>
		<modifier>
			<conditions>
				<unit>
					<level greater="1"/>
				</unit>
			</conditions>
			<effects>
				<feelNoPainDamageReduction add="0.17"/>
			</effects>
		</modifier>
		<modifier>
			<conditions>
				<unit>
					<level greater="4"/>
				</unit>
			</conditions>
			<effects>
