				<circumstanceMeleeDamage mul="0.1"/>
			</effects>
		</modifier>
		<modifier>
			<conditions>
				<unit>
					<level greater="8"/>
				</unit>
			</conditions>
			<effects>
				<moraleLossFactor add="-0.67"/>
			</effects>
		</modifier>
	</modifiers>
</trait>

Raiders Tactics.description: Grants bonus traits when this unit disembarks from a transport.
Raiders Tactics.flavor: “Why do we ride atop these elegant craft? The better to hear the screams of our prey as we ride them down, to savour the fear etched on their faces, to taste the tantalising tang of their blood in the air as an appetiser before the feast. But most of all we ride them so that the slaughter may begin as soon as possible.” – Dariaq Bladetongue of the Pierced Eye
Raiders Tactics.modifiers:
<trait category="Buff" visible="1">
	<onUnitDisembarked>
		<area affects="Unit">
			<modifiers>
				<modifier requiredUpgrade="Drukhari/RaidersTacticsDamage">
					<effects>
						<addTrait name="Drukhari/RaidersTacticsDamage" duration="1"/>
					</effects>
				</modifier>
				<modifier requiredUpgrade="Drukhari/RaidersTacticsDamageReduction">
					<effects>
						<addTrait name="Drukhari/RaidersTacticsDamageReduction" duration="1"/>
					</effects>	
				</modifier>
			</modifiers>
		</area>
	</onUnitDisembarked>
</trait>

Raider Assault.flavor: Millenia of depredations on the mortal plane mean the Drukhari are inhuman opportunity predators unparalleled in history. This is partly from centuries of experience, partly from evolution and partly from the adaptations of the Haemonculi. When they emerge from their skycraft, they fall upon their enemy like descending eagles.

Raider Evasion.flavor: The Drukhari live to inflict pain—and there are crucial moments in their existence that exemplify this. When an incubi’s glaive falls; when a Wych torments her victim in the arena; and the split-second of deadly surprise as the Drukhari raiders leap from their skycraft…

Raider Readiness.description: Increases the healing rate when this unit is embarked in a vehicle.
Raider Readiness.flavor: “Friends—I call you that, though I know you’d knife me in the back at a glance from Vect—friends, hold yourselves ready. The moment is almost here, the herd do not even know we’re coming. In but minutes, we will descend, flay, rend, torment, murder and drink their souls… with style, of course. We’re not savages.” – Gyrthineus Roche, Archon of The Last Blade

Shadowfield.flavor: The shadow field surrounds its wearer in a dark miasma of energy that is almost impossible to penetrate. However, should a solid blow connect the field will short out, leaving its wearer vulnerable.

Sacrifice to Khaine.flavor: The Drukhari do not worship the old Aeldari gods or the OId Ones, save for one—Kaela Mensha Khaine, god of murder and war. Only a handful of Drukhari pay fealty to Khaine and most of those are Incubi, the dark mirrors of the Aeldari aspect warriors. Every time they kill with their ritual glaives, it is in praise of Khaine.

Shroud Gate.flavor: “It was a wise to lay the ambush at the webway gate, brave little human. Hush, now. But you did not know when and where we would emerge, and that was your mistake. To we Drukhari, the gates are an unnecessary convenience… but your suffering, that I am afraid, is a necessity.” – Gyrthineus Roche, Archon of The Last Blade

Soul Hunger.description: Grants influence when killing an enemy.
Soul Hunger.flavor: The only form of sustenance that refreshes a Drukhari—the only thing that makes their immortal lives at all palatable and endurable, as Slaanesh saps their souls—is the suffering of others. And those Archons who can ensure a regular supply of victims and of pain receive loyalty—or rather, the nearest to it that a Drukhari can manage…

Soulbread and Circuses.flavor: In a world so devoid of loyalty, it pays to keep the masses on side—who knows when you will need to drive a lynch mob after your rival, for example? When an Archon pays for a Wych cult to perform in the arena or dispenses food, weapons or victims to the desperate of Commorragh’s undercity, every Drukhari understands that he does it not from compassion, but out of calculation.

Soul Tithe.flavor: Of course, all Drukhari Kabalites are thoroughly beholden to their Archon and would do nothing to lose their favour… yet, somehow, still, there manages to be a thriving black market in stolen resources, especially further away from the seat of power. So when the order comes in to send their tithes, it’s surprisingly easy to gather enough.

Soul Harvest.description: Increases the damage and grants influence when killing an enemy.
Soul Harvest.flavor: Few Drukhari leaders trust their underlings enough to allow them to gain power, knowing full well that the only rational use of power is to overthrow their oppressor. Despite this, occasionally a minion might be allowed off the leash, as long as its victories reflect entirely upon the Archon.
Soul Harvest.modifiers:
<trait category="Buff" icon="Actions/Drukhari/SoulHarvest" alwaysVisible="1" rankMax="2">
	<modifiers>
		<modifier>
			<effects>
				<damage mul="0.17"/>
				<influencePerKillValue addMin="3" addMax="9"/>
			</effects>
		</modifier>
	</modifiers>
</trait>

Feast of Torment.flavor: Encouraging the Drukhari to acts of sadism is unnecessary, it comes so naturally to them. However, they still fear their Archon’s wrath, so giving them explicit permission to torture the innocents of Gladius Prime rather than ship them back to Commorragh is sometimes necessary. As a side note, innocent blood has a wonderfully rejuvenating effect.

Spirit Probe.flavor: A spirit probe is a conductor for agony; a device that ensures no scrap of pain or misery escapes the Cronos’ contra-empathic net. Running hot on tides of excruciation, it boosts the resilience of nearby Drukhari, allowing them to stride laughing amid volleys of fire and rains of blows that would otherwise tear them apart.
Spirit Probe.modifiers:
<trait category="Buff">
	<modifiers>
		<modifier>
			<conditions>
				<unit>
					<allied/>
					<noTrait name="Fortification"/>
					<noTrait name="Vehicle"/>
					<trait name="Drukhari/PowerFromPain"/>
					<level greater="1"/>
				</unit>
			</conditions>
			<effects>
				<feelNoPainDamageReduction add="0.17"/>
			</effects>
		</modifier>
	</modifiers>
</trait>

Towering Arrogance.flavor: A Haemonculus is possessed of the knowledge that his fleshcrafting skills make him effectively immortal so has nothing but scorn for the foe, no matter how horrifying their aspect. A Haemonculus and his coven will hold their place with a derisive sneer, regardless of the odds stacked against them, anticipating the pain and death to come.

Studies in Agony.description: Grants research when killing an enemy.
Studies in Agony.flavor: “Near to death, I hold them. The secrets they whisper. The pleas. Tactics, inventions, knowledge of the other side, revelations… everything spilled. To stop the pain. Why should it stop, though. When it is so… productive.” – Arkanic, Haemonculus to Kabal of The Last Blade

Weapon Racks.description: Grants twin-linked for one turn to units that disembark from this vehicle.
Weapon Racks.flavor: Some Drukhari vehicles carry additional racks of anti-personnel weaponry on their decks. This allows passengers to literally empty their weapons’ magazines in great raking fusillades, before discarding their spent guns in favour of fully-loaded replacements as they disembark.

Whirling Death.description: Hits all group members of the target unit.
Whirling Death.flavor: This murder-artist is constantly moving, their every acrobatic step accompanied by a lashing blade. They are at their most dangerous when the foe believes them surrounded, but this simply gives them more victims to practice their killing art upon.

'Eavy Armor.flavor: Ork 'eavy armour is hammered out of scrap iron, sheet metal and the looted battle-plate of fallen foes. Though its fit is dubious, 'eavy armour provides a solid defence for its wearer.

Aerobatic Grace.description: Grants ranged damage reduction if the unit has moved this turn.
Aerobatic Grace.flavor: While the Harlequins are the true masters of dance amongst the Aeldari, the Shining Spears approach them in their control of their jetbikes, seeming to pirouette between storms of bolter fire as they charge their foe.

Kurnous' Summons.flavor: The Crimson Hunters owe their allegiance to Kurnous, the Aeldari God of the Hunt. Though he is 60 million years dead, when his name is invoked they redouble their efforts, both in recruitment and construction.

Ancient Doom.description: Increases the accuracy and damage taken against Chaos units.
Ancient Doom.flavor: The Aeldari loathe and fear She Who Thirsts above all else, for in Slaanesh they see their doom made manifest.

Sub-Molecular Ammunition.flavor: The unique shuriken ammunition of the Aeldari consists of monomolecular spinning blades fired at great speed. But molecules are so limiting when there are smaller, more deadly structures to use.

Assured Destruction.flavor:
“If a captain is foolish enough to allow five Aeldari with meltaguns and several millenia of combat experience to get within 20 metres of his tank… well, frankly, he deserves to be a molten puddle of ichor on the floor.”
  — Commissar Gruber

Asuryani Arrivals.flavor: At a word from the commanding Farseer, a psychic missive is sent out through the Webway, to the craftworlds, exodite planets and roving Rangers, requesting support in this critical endeavour. Though the Aeldari race is dying, they will die fighting—and they come to Gladius to die there.

Autarch's Assault.modifiers:
<trait visible="0" category="Buff" icon="Actions/Eldar/AutarchsAssault" rankMax="2">
	<onEnemyKilledSelf>
		<area affects="Unit" radius="3">
			<modifiers>
				<modifier>
					<conditions>
						<unit>
							<allied/>
							<faction name="Eldar"/>
						</unit>
					</conditions>
					<effects>
						<addTrait duration="1" name="Eldar/AutarchsAssault"/>
					</effects>
				</modifier>
			</modifiers>
		</area>
	</onEnemyKilledSelf>
</trait>

Banshee Mask.description: Prevents the unit from being targeted by overwatch attacks.
Banshee Mask.flavor: These amplify the Aeldari’s battle cry, inflicting psychic paralysis.

Battle Focus.flavor: When the Asuryani don their war masks, they enter a battle trance so focused that they flow across the battlefield like quicksilver, killing their foes without breaking stride.

Exodite Foothold.flavor: Despite the millenia they’ve spent drifting the stars, some Rangers of the Craftworld Aeldari have passed time on the Exodite worlds and Maiden worlds, and have learned how to establish life planetside, growing food and constructing their wraithbone buildings in the ancient ways.

Exodite Infrastructure.flavor: Experienced Exodite construction designs are being employed by the Craftworld’s Bonesingers here. Only having worked on the ancient Craftworlds, the idea of building a city for the first time is something utterly new to their minds.

Command.flavor: Autarchs walk the Path of Command, and even the Exarchs of the aspect shrines defer to them. An Autarch personally co-ordinates the fire of his army, with deft signals and comms, combining firepower and movement to lure enemies into ingenious death-traps.
Command.modifiers:
<trait alwaysVisible="1" category="Buff" icon="Actions/Eldar/Command" rankMax="2">
	<modifiers>
		<modifier>
			<effects>
				<accuracy mulMin="0.05" mulMax="0.15"/>
			</effects>
		</modifier>
	</modifiers>
</trait>

Bonesinger Convocation.flavor: Bonesingers are rare and cherished, even among the scattered Aeldari—but they have come in numbers to the Farseer’s summons, to capture this unique planet for their dying race.

Crack Shot.description: Increases the accuracy and armour penetration.
Crack Shot.flavor: The Fire Dragons are rightly feared as tank hunters and none more so than their Exarch, who leads his squad from the front, inspiring his squad to more destruction with his own devastating feats.

Crystal Targeting Matrix.flavor: Utilising advanced scanner technologies, this targeting matrix allows pinpoint fire even when on the move.

Doom.flavor: With a simple manipulation of that which is to come, the Farseer grants a darkened fate to a chosen foe. While this shadow rests upon the enemy’s soul, death seeks them out above all others, each blow or shot that comes their way rendered inescapably lethal.

Expert Hunter.description: Increases the damage against monstrous creatures, vehicles and fortifications.
Expert Hunter.flavor: The Shining Spears weaponry might be short-ranged but their Star Lances and Laser Lances are incredibly powerful, as they weave around larger targets, spying out their weak points.
Expert Hunter.modifiers:
<trait alwaysVisible="1" category="Buff">
	<modifiers>
		<modifier>
			<conditions>
				<encounter>
					<opponent match="Any">
						<trait name="Fortification"/>
						<trait name="MonstrousCreature"/>
						<trait name="Vehicle"/>
					</opponent>
				</encounter>
			</conditions>
			<effects>
				<damage mul="0.33"/>
			</effects>
		</modifier>
	</modifiers>
</trait>

Exquisite Cultivation.flavor: So intensely do the Aeldari feel that even their basic foodstuffs are works of art, cultivated by craftsmen that have spent millenia perfecting their cuisine. With a wider range of ingredients and seasonings, they can work miracles with the seeming simplest foodstuffs.

Forceshield.flavor: These powerful shield projectors can deflect almost any blow.

Engine of Vaul.flavor: Whilst humanity’s plasma weaponry is often fatal to its users, the elegant Aeldari equivalents harbour no such threats. And now a chance discovery on Gladius Prime’s surface has allowed the Bonesingers and Exarchs to further improve their focus.

Holo-Fields.description: Increases the damage reduction if the unit has moved this turn.
Holo-Fields.flavor: Harnessing kinetic energy to shimmer and distort the vehicle’s silhouette, holo-fields prevent the foe from accurately targeting the craft as it sweeps across the battlefield.

Inescapable Accuracy.description: Increases the accuracy against bikes, jetbikes, flyers and vehicles that moved this turn.
Inescapable Accuracy.flavor: Inherited aeons of combat experience against their kin, the raiding Drukhari, has taught the Dark Reaper Aspect Warriors of the Craftworld Aeldari how to track even their own jinking, holofield-protected jetbikes. Hitting such targets with their deadly Reaper missiles is simple to them—and all part of their emulation of Khaine in his role of The Destroyer.
Inescapable Accuracy.modifiers:
<trait alwaysVisible="1">
	<modifiers>
		<modifier>
			<conditions>
				<encounter>
					<opponent match="Any">
						<trait name="Flyer"/>
						<trait name="Jetbike"/>
						<trait name="Bike"/>
						<trait name="Vehicle"/>
					</opponent>
				</encounter>
				<encounter>
					<opponent>
						<movedThisTurn/>
					</opponent>
				</encounter>
			</conditions>
			<effects>
				<rangedAccuracy mul="0.17"/>
			</effects>
		</modifier>
	</modifiers>
</trait>

Asuryan's Summons.flavor: Asurmen is the founder of the path of the Warrior and the first of the Phoenix Lords, the creators of the Aspect Shrines. Invoking his name will surely bring more warriors to Gladius Prime, to seize this planet for the Aeldari.

Lileath's Oracle.flavor: Very few mortal beings have ever had the foresight of a Farseer—a power perhaps derived from the lost Aeldari goddess Lileath, who predicted the death of the gods at the hands of the mortal Aeldari. An oracle that invokes her name draws the eyes of all Aeldari upon you…

Jinx.flavor: Chained by runes of power, fate itself is bound to the Spiritseer’s will.

Khaine Awakened.description: Increases the melee attacks and melee damage, decreases the morale loss and grants immunity to fear and pinning.
Khaine Awakened.flavor: As the Wailing Doom cries out for blood and the Avatar rouses itself for war, so too are nearby Aeldari driven to greater deeds in his name. Fearing nothing, they throw themselves into the melee battle-crazed.
Khaine Awakened.modifiers:
<trait category="Buff" icon="Actions/Eldar/KhaineAwakened">
	<modifiers>
		<modifier>
			<conditions>
				<unit>
					<allied/>
					<faction name="Eldar"/>
				</unit>
			</conditions>
			<effects>
				<meleeAttacks mul="0.17"/>
				<circumstanceMeleeDamage mul="0.17"/>
				<moraleLossFactor add="-0.67"/>
			</effects>
		</modifier>
	</modifiers>
</trait>

Khaine's Might.flavor: An Autarch has mastery of all the Exarch shrines and has learned something from them all. Few mortal creatures can stand against the skill of an Autarch when fully unleashed.
Khaine's Might.modifiers:
<trait alwaysVisible="1" category="Buff" icon="Actions/Eldar/KhainesMight" rankMax="2">
	<modifiers>
		<modifier>
			<effects>
				<meleeAttacks mulMin="0.25" mulMax="0.75"/>
			</effects>
		</modifier>
	</modifiers>
</trait>

Linked Fire.description: Increases the damage and armour penetration of the Prism Cannon.
Linked Fire.flavor: The unusual design of a Fire Prism’s Prism Cannon crystal is designed to allow it to further concentrate its already-intense beam by feeding it into another Fire Prism, focusing both machine’s firepower into a single shot.
Linked Fire.modifiers:
<trait category="Buff" icon="Actions/Eldar/LinkedFire">
	<modifiers>
		<modifier>
			<conditions>
				<weapon match="Any">
					<type name="PrismCannonLance"/>
					<type name="PrismCannonFocused"/>
					<type name="PrismCannonDispersed"/>
				</weapon>
			</conditions>
			<effects>
				<damage mul="1.0"/>
				<armorPenetration add="2"/>
			</effects>
		</modifier>
	</modifiers>
</trait>

Marksman's Eye.flavor: Only a Crimson Hunter would consider piloting the fastest, most manuevrable Aeldari craft to involve so little challenge, that they also are able to aim and fire three separate weapons with differing fire rates at the same time.

Sub-Molecular Planes.flavor: The monomolecular filaments and blades of the Aeldari are lethal enough by themselves, but with the smallest addition of phasing technology (as used in the Harlequin’s Caress), they pass through even the thickest armour.

Mind War.flavor: The Farseer reaches out to attack the mind of an enemy in a desperate mental duel. Foes find their thoughts invaded by the crushing presence of the Farseer, his ancient and inscrutable will extinguishing their personality with horrific ease, triggering a cascade of psychosomatic trauma.

Molten Body.description: Immune to flame and melta weapons.
Molten Body.flavor: The Avatar of Khaine isn’t merely the last fragment of a dying god—more practically, it’s a construct of super-heated iron with a core that is literally lava, animated by the psychic power of the Aeldari and the god’s undying rage. Heating it up only makes it more angry…
Molten Body.modifiers:
<trait alwaysVisible="1" category="Buff">
	<modifiers>
		<modifier>
			<conditions>
				<encounter>
					<opponent>
						<attacking/>
					</opponent>
					<weapon match="Any">
						<trait name="Flame"/>
						<trait name="Melta"/>
					</weapon>
				</encounter>
			</conditions>
			<effects>
				<damageTaken max="0"/>
			</effects>
		</modifier>
	</modifiers>
</trait>

Extraction Efficiency.flavor: The Aeldari require metals less than other races, given that almost all of their structures and vehicles are psychic energy made tangible, in the form of wraithbone. But for the small amount they need, there are always improvements to be made.

Power Field.flavor: Power fields reroute a portion of the vehicle’s energy supply to project a glimmering shield of protection around the vehicle.

Protect.flavor: Chained by runes of power, fate itself is bound to the Spiritseer’s will.

Reaper Rangefinder.description: Ignores ranged damage reduction granted by Jink and Skilled Jink.
Reaper Rangefinder.flavor: Mounted in the helmet vanes of the Dark Reapers are highly advanced targeters that calculate telemetries in the blink of an eye.

Remnants of the Fall.flavor: Since the birth of Slaanesh, the remaining Aeldari have struggled to survive in a hostile galaxy. Their aeon-long lifespans mean that they always had a low fertility rate and slow gestation, so they struggle to replace those who fall in battle. On many Craftworlds, the dead far outnumber the living.

Black Librarians.flavor: The Farseers of the Black Library dispatched us on this errand and now they offer their support. With access to their archives, we should be able to rediscover lost technologies and more rapidly improve our foothold on this planet.

Return of the Aeldari.description: Increases the flat amount of resources gained from outposts.
Return of the Aeldari.flavor: After the disappearance of the Old Ones, the Aeldari ruled this planet for millions of years. They understand better than anyone else how to best cultivate and access its unique resources.

Rune Armour.flavor: Aeldari psykers fashion themselves elegant armour decorated with wraithbone runes. Said to pulse in time with the wearer’s heartbeat, rune armour offers protection against attacks both spiritual and physical in nature.

Scattershield.description: Increases the damage reduction and blinds infantry and monstrous creature melee attackers.
Scattershield.flavor: Used to protect precious Aeldari war-constructs, scattershields are gigantic fan-shaped shield generators that convert the energy of incoming attacks into blinding sprays of multicoloured light.

Serpent Shield.description: Increases the armour while Serpent Shield weapon is not on cooldown.
Serpent Shield.flavor: When the Aeldari Wave Serpents advance, they do so behind powerful shields. These can be discharged to unleash a bow wave of raw force that blasts the enemy from their feet.

Skyhunter.description: Increases the armour penetration against flyers.
Skyhunter.flavor: The spirit of a lost Exarch of Biel-Tan has infused our Crimson Hunters, revealing secrets from millenia of battling the foes of the Aeldari. Her rediscovered wisdom will enable us to dominate the skies as never before.

Spirit Mark.flavor: The Avatar’s presence invigorates the dead distinctly from the living. Whilst the latter are filled with Khaine’s incandescent rage, those machines manned by spirit crystals instead find their awareness raised from their usual somnambulance, enabling them to better focus on their targets.
Spirit Mark.modifiers:
<trait category="Buff" icon="Actions/Eldar/SpiritMark">
	<modifiers>
		<modifier>
			<conditions>
				<unit>
					<allied/>
				</unit>
				<unit match="Any">
					<type name="Eldar/Wraithblade"/>
					<type name="Eldar/Wraithknight"/>
				</unit>
			</conditions>
			<effects>
				<accuracy add="1"/>
			</effects>
		</modifier>
	</modifiers>
</trait>

Spirit Preservation.flavor: We are few in number and She Who Thirsts waits in the Warp, to consume our souls. However, we wear Spirit Stones to capture our essence at the moment of death; though every Aeldari shudders in distaste at the thought, when recovered these spirits can be used to guide our war machines.

Spirit Stones.flavor: Some Aeldari vehicles incorporate large spirit stones with a captive animus that can control the vehicle should it be disabled.

Star Engines.flavor: Whilst all Aeldari vehicles are swift and agile, those that mount star engines are often able to move faster than the eye can follow. Lesser races can only marvel at the phenomenal speed and manoeuvrability of a craft so equipped.

Titan Holo-Fields.description: Increases the damage reduction if the unit has moved this turn.
Titan Holo-Fields.flavor:
“I was watching the best-best light show in the Hive, all elsparks and bang-bangs and shinies and sooo psychedelic… then I wowed around and the Irregulars was dead-dead and that alien tank just rolled on past me like I was plastidough.”
  — Trooper Grande, sole survivor of the Necromundan Fourth Irregulars

Transcendent Bliss.flavor: The life of an Aeldari is infinitely richer than that of a human, given their tremendous sensitivity, intellect and intensity of feeling—and sometimes it takes shared moments of that bliss to remind the Aeldari what they’re fighting for in this dark universe.
Transcendent Bliss.modifiers:
<trait visibilityCategory="Building" icon="Actions/Eldar/TranscendentBliss">
	<modifiers>
		<modifier>
			<conditions>
				<building>
					<type name="Eldar/Headquarters"/>
				</building>
			</conditions>
			<effects>
				<loyalty add="3"/>
			</effects>
		</modifier>
		<modifier requiredUpgrade="Eldar/TranscendentBlissBonus">
			<conditions>
				<building>
					<type name="Eldar/Headquarters"/>
				</building>
			</conditions>
			<effects>
				<loyalty add="3"/>
			</effects>
		</modifier>
	</modifiers>
</trait>

Vector Dancer.description: Increases the armour against ranged attacks.
Vector Dancer.flavor: Some aircraft are crafted with an eye towards manoeuvrability.

Vectored Engines.description: Increases the armour against ranged attacks.
Vectored Engines.flavor: Vectored engines allow the pilot of an Aeldari vehicle to rapidly alter its facing, placing deadly weapons, or stronger armour, to the fore. Often, this can mean the difference between sustaining critical damage and taking an indirect blow that can soon be shrugged off.

Vaul's Summons.flavor: A spirit stone recovered from Gladius proved to be that of an ancient Bonesinger, lost here millenia past. With their insights into the planet’s structure and resources, we’re able to greatly increase our production.

Enslaved.description: Kill Enslaver to free the unit.

'Ere We Go!.flavor: Ever eager to get stuck into the fray, Orks will barrel across the battlefield as quick as they can when the foe is in their sights.

Fear.flavor: Some beings are so monstrous or alien that they can force their foes to recoil in horror.
Fear.modifiers:
<trait category="Debuff">
	<perTurnModifiers endure="0">
		<modifier>
			<conditions>
				<unit>
					<enemy/>
					<noTrait name="AndTheyShallKnowNoFear"/>
					<noTrait name="Fearless"/>
					<noTrait name="Eldar/KhaineAwakened"/>
					<noTrait name="Tyranids/SynapseLink"/>
					<noTrait name="Zealot"/>
				</unit>
			</conditions>
			<effects>
				<morale add="-2"/>
			</effects>
		</modifier>
	</perTurnModifiers>
</trait>

Fearless.description: Reduces the morale loss and grants immunity to fear and pinning.
Fearless.flavor: Fearless troops never give up and seldom take full use of cover—even if it would be wiser to do so.

Feel No Pain.flavor: Whether through force of will, bionic augmentation or foul sorcery, this warrior can fight despite fearsome wounds.

Flail.flavor: Equipped with a flail weapon, these warriors hinder attackers on approach.

Fleet.flavor: Preternaturally agile, these warriors can cover ground more quickly than their plodding foes.

Fleshbane.description: Increases the damage against infantry and monstrous creature units.
Fleshbane.modifiers:
<trait alwaysVisible="1" category="Buff" visibilityCategory="Weapon">
	<modifiers>
		<modifier>
			<conditions>
				<encounter>
					<opponent>
						<noTrait name="Fortification"/>
						<noTrait name="Vehicle"/>
					</opponent>
				</encounter>
			</conditions>
			<effects>
				<damage add="4"/>
			</effects>
		</modifier>
	</modifiers>
</trait>

Flyer.description: Can fly over cliffs, water and enemy units. Cannot capture artefacts or outposts. Ignores zone of control of enemy ground units. Cannot be hit by ground melee weapons and are hard to hit by ground weapons without skyfire. No penalty for heavy and ordnance weapons.
Flyer.flavor: The airspace above a battle is thronged with activity. Fighters and bomber craft hurtle through the skies, duelling with one another providing fire support for the troops on the ground.

Forest.description: Increases the ranged damage reduction of infantry units.
Forest.flavor: Gladius' fast-growing forests persist all year around, the vegetal growth stretching to the sky, and blocking lines of sight. Gladius' plants may seem treelike, but they're actually iron-hard, as they draw ores from deep under the planet's surface.
Forest.modifiers:
<trait category="Buff">
	<modifiers>
		<modifier>
			<conditions>
				<unit>
					<noTrait name="City"/>
					<noTrait name="Flyer"/>
					<noTrait name="Fortification"/>
					<noTrait name="MonstrousCreature"/>
					<noTrait name="Vehicle"/>
				</unit>
			</conditions>
			<effects>
				<rangedDamageReduction add="0.33"/>
			</effects>
		</modifier>
	</modifiers>
</trait>

Forest Stealth.description: Increases the ranged damage reduction while in a forest.

Fortification.description: Stationary and fortified unit. If armed, it exerts control over adjacent outposts.

Fuelled By Rage.description: Increases the attacks when the unit's hitpoints decrease.

Furious Charge.flavor: Some warriors use the impetus of the charge to fuel their own fury.

Gargantuan.flavor: Gargantuan creatures are of such immense size that they can take on entire armies. They tower over the battlefield, making the ground shudder as they advance upon the foe, crushing lesser creatures beneath their feet as they lumber forwards.

Gauss.description: Scales the minimum damage with the hitpoints of the target unit.
Gauss.flavor: Gauss weapons vary in appearance from the rifle-sized flayers to the massive heavy gauss cannon. Unlike more conventional energy weapons, a gauss projector emits a molecular disassembling beam, reducing flesh, bone and even armour to its constituent atoms.

Atomic Flayers.flavor: For a galaxy full of cruel, monstrous or insane weaponry, Gauss technology is particularly feared. A bolter shell will just explode inside you, but a Gauss weapon will flay you alive, atom by atom.

Gets Hot.description: The unit loses hitpoints each time a ranged weapon fires.
Gets Hot.flavor: Some weapons are fuelled by unstable power sources and risk overheating with each shot—often to the detriment of the wielder.

Graviton.description: Scales the damage with the armour of the target unit.
Graviton.flavor: Some weapons crush their enemies within their own armour.

Grot Riggers.flavor: Whether hurriedly re-attaching gubbinz with rivet guns, or just getting out and pushing, a crew of grot riggers can help to keep an Ork vehicle in the fight long after it should have fallen apart.

Hammer of Wrath.description: Increases the damage of non-Bomb weapons.
Hammer of Wrath.flavor: Many warriors hurl themselves headlong into combat, seeking to crush or trample the foe.

Hammerhand.flavor: Focussing the raging power of his mind, the psyker augments the strength of his comrades to the point where they can crush flesh and bone with a single blow.

Hallucination.flavor: Paranoia, confusion and panic are heightened to a debilitating degree as the telepath alters his foes’ perceptions.

Harvest Resource Tiles.description: Harvests resources from adjacent special resource features.

Haywire.description: Increases the damage and ignores armour against vehicles and fortifications.
Haywire.flavor: Haywire weapons send out powerful electromagnetic pulses.
Haywire.modifiers:
<trait alwaysVisible="1">
	<modifiers>
		<modifier>
			<conditions>
				<encounter>
					<opponent match="Any">
						<trait name="Fortification"/>
						<trait name="Vehicle"/>
					</opponent>
				</encounter>
			</conditions>
			<effects>
				<damage add="3"/>
				<armorPenetration min="100"/>
			</effects>
		</modifier>
	</modifiers>
</trait>

Headquarters.description: Destroying the headquarters unit destroys the entire city.

Heavy.modifiers:
<trait alwaysVisible="1">
	<modifiers>
		<modifier>
			<conditions>
				<unit>
					<movedThisTurn/>
					<noTrait name="Flyer"/>
					<noTrait name="Fortification"/>
					<noTrait name="Relentless"/>
					<noTrait name="SlowAndPurposeful"/>
					<noTrait name="Vehicle"/>
				</unit>
			</conditions>
			<effects>
				<accuracy mul="-0.5"/>
			</effects>
		</modifier>
	</modifiers>
</trait>

Hellstorm Template.description: Hits with increased accuracy against multiple group members of the target unit.

Hero.description: Increases the damage reduction of infantry units.
Hero.flavor: What is it to be a hero? Many would define one as an unusually brave, smart or strong member of a species. In a universe of endless war, that sadly tends to mean someone who is very, very good at causing the deaths of their enemies, and somehow surviving.
Hero.modifiers:
<trait alwaysVisible="1">
	<modifiers>
		<modifier>
			<conditions>
				<unit>
					<noTrait name="Flyer"/>
					<noTrait name="MonstrousCreature"/>
					<noTrait name="Vehicle"/>
				</unit>
			</conditions>
			<effects>
				<heroDamageReduction add="0.5"/>
			</effects>
		</modifier>
		<modifier>
			<effects>
				<duplicateTypeCost mul="1.0"/>
			</effects>
		</modifier>
	</modifiers>
</trait>

Hit & Run.flavor: Some troops employ a flexible battle stance, engaging the foe at close quarters one moment, before peeling off to strike with renewed vigour the next.

Homing.description: Does not require line of sight.

Ignores Cover.description: Ignores the ranged damage reduction of the target unit.
Ignores Cover.flavor: This weapon fires ammunition that cheats an enemy of his shelter.

Imperial Ruins.description: Increases the ranged damage reduction of infantry units.
Imperial Ruins.flavor: The pre-invasion human colony was built for defense and mineral exploitation. Nothing was designed to stand the tectonic shifts and warp-born horrors that came with the Ork invasion, and hence very few structures weathered it. This ruin is a rare survivor.
Imperial Ruins.modifiers:
<trait category="Buff" icon="Features/ImperialRuin">
	<modifiers>
		<modifier>
			<conditions>
				<unit>
					<noTrait name="City"/>
					<noTrait name="Flyer"/>
					<noTrait name="Fortification"/>
					<noTrait name="MonstrousCreature"/>
					<noTrait name="Vehicle"/>
				</unit>
			</conditions>
			<effects>
				<rangedDamageReduction add="0.33"/>
			</effects>
		</modifier>
	</modifiers>
</trait>

Imperial Splendour.flavor: A successful planetary governor will reflect his domain's newfound wealth with monuments to the Imperium—mammoth plascrete basilica and statues of Space Marines, Primarchs and the Emperor.

Infiltrate.description: Prevents the unit from being targeted by overwatch attacks.
Infiltrate.flavor: Many armies employ reconnaissance troops who sit concealed for days, just waiting for the right moment in which to strike.

Instant Death.description: Greatly increases the damage against infantry and monstrous creature units.
Instant Death.flavor: Some blows can slay an enemy outright, no matter how hardy he may be.

Iron Halo.flavor: The iron halo is an honour granted to Space Marine commanders and a symbol of their exceptional bravery and wisdom. Usually mounted upon the backpack or built into an armoured collar, it contains an energy field that wards against even the most potent of enemy weapons.

Iron Will.description: After dying, the Lord Commissar immediately comes back to life.
Iron Will.flavor:
“Pain is temporary, Honour is forever.”
  — Colonel-Commissar Ibram Gaunt, Tanith First and Only

It Will Not Die.flavor: In the dark corners of the galaxy, there are creatures that heal at a terrifying speed.

Jet Pack.description: The unit can move over water. Ignores the penalties of rivers and wire weed.
Jet Pack.flavor: Jet packs are designed to provide stable firing platforms rather than a means of getting into close combat.

Jetbike.description: The unit can move over water. Ignores the penalties of rivers and wire weed.
Jetbike.flavor: The technology to make reliable and small fast skimmers is more difficult than it looks, and for many years only the Aeldari had the technical know-how. More recently, the Orks have developed their own clunky version, the Deffkopta, and the emerging Necrons have brought with them unpredictable Tomb Blades.

Jink.description: Increases the ranged damage reduction but reduces the accuracy.
Jink.flavor: Some units favour speed and agility rather than heavy armour to keep them alive on the battlefield, dodging and weaving unscathed through hails of incoming fire.

Killshot.description: Increases the damage against monstrous creatures, vehicles and fortifications when adjacent to an allied Predator.
Killshot.flavor: There are few things that can stand before the combined might of a Predator Assassin Squadron—a trio of Predators—their Space Marine gunners creating interlocking kill-zones to bring down even massive xenos creatures or slab-sided war machines in a focussed barrage cannon fire.
Killshot.modifiers:
<trait alwaysVisible="1">
	<modifiers>
		<modifier>
			<conditions>
				<encounter>
					<opponent match="Any">
						<trait name="Fortification"/>
						<trait name="MonstrousCreature"/>
						<trait name="Vehicle"/>
					</opponent>
				</encounter>
				<unit>
					<unitsInRange count="1" range="1">
						<allied/>
						<type name="SpaceMarines/Predator"/>
					</unitsInRange>
				</unit>
			</conditions>
			<effects>
				<damage mul="0.33"/>
			</effects>
		</modifier>
	</modifiers>
</trait>

Lance.description: Limits the armour of the target unit.
Lance.flavor: The terror of tank commanders, a lance weapon fires a concentrated beam of energy that can bore through any armour, regardless of thickness.

Large Blast.description: Hits multiple group members of the target unit.
Large Blast.flavor: Blast weapons fire shells, missiles or packets of energy that explode on impact.

Last Stand.flavor:
“Here we stand and here shall we die, unbroken and unbowed. Though the very hand of death itself come for us, we will spit our defiance to the end!”
  — Chaplain Armand Titus of the Howling Griffons

Life Drain.description: Increases the damage against infantry and monstrous creature units.
Life Drain.modifiers:
<trait alwaysVisible="1" category="Buff" visibilityCategory="Weapon">
	<modifiers>
		<modifier>
			<conditions>
				<encounter>
					<opponent>
						<noTrait name="Fortification"/>
						<noTrait name="Vehicle"/>
					</opponent>
				</encounter>
			</conditions>
			<effects>
				<damage mul="0.33"/>
			</effects>
		</modifier>
	</modifiers>
</trait>

Life Steal.description: Converts damage into healing for this and adjacent infantry and monstrous creature units.

Linebreaker Bombardment.description: Ignores the ranged damage reduction of the target unit when adjacent to an allied Vindicator.

Luminagen.description: Temporarily decreases the ranged damage reduction of the target unit.

Locator Beacon.description: Causes orbital deployment to not consume action points when deploying adjacent to this unit.
Locator Beacon.flavor: Locator beacons are often carried by Scout Bikers or mounted onto Drop Pods, and provide a signalling package, broad-spectrum communicators, and geo-positional tracking. When activated, the beacon uploads detailed positional information to the tactical grid, allowing precision reinforcement by reserve forces.

Machine Empathy.flavor:
“Consider the Predator. Let your soul be armoured with Faith, driven on the tracks of obedience which overcomes all obstacles, and armed with the three great guns of Zeal, Duty and Purity.”
  — Traditional Imperial prayer, source unknown
Machine Empathy.modifiers:
<trait category="Buff" icon="Actions/MachineEmpathy">
	<perTurnModifiers endure="0">
		<modifier>
			<conditions>
				<unit match="Any">
					<trait name="Fortification"/>
					<trait name="Vehicle"/>
				</unit>
			</conditions>
			<effects>
				<hitpoints add="3"/>
			</effects>
		</modifier>
	</perTurnModifiers>
</trait>

Massive Blast.description: Hits multiple group members of the target unit.
Massive Blast.flavor: Blast weapons fire shells, missiles or packets of energy that explode on impact.

Master-Crafted.flavor: Some weapons are lovingly maintained artefacts, crafted with a skill now lost. Though the exact form of master-crafting varies, it is always considered to be the pinnacle of the weaponsmith’s art.

Melee.flavor: Warriors across the galaxy employ a wide variety of close-quarter weapons. Blood-flecked chainswords and crude knives take their places alongside powered weapons of all kinds: swords, axes, hammers and many more. All such weapons are designed to bring quick and painful death to the foe, for every moment's delay brings defeat a step closer.

Melta.description: Increases the armour penetration at half range.
Melta.flavor: Melta weapons are lethal anti-armour guns, most effective at very short range. When fired, the super-heating of the air produces a distinctive and sinister hiss. Solid rock is reduced to molten slag, and living creatures are vaporised in an instant!

Misfortune.flavor: With a click of his fingers, the diviner twists fate so that his followers' blows punch through the weakest points in their opponent's armour.

Mob Rule.description: Reduces the morale loss based on the amount of allied units in the area.
Mob Rule.flavor: Orks are simplistic, brutal creatures who love to fight and draw confidence from possessing strength in numbers.

Mobile Command.description: Passive abilities work for cargo embarked on this transport.
Mobile Command.flavor: A transport vehicle is typically sealed, rendering any troops ineffective (but protected) until they reach their destination. Unlike gun slits, communication equipment doesn’t compromise the protection, as the Imperial Chimera command variant proves out, enabling commanders to continue to direct their forces.

Monofilament.description: Inversely scales the accuracy with the maximum movement of the target unit. Increases the armour penetration.
Monofilament.flavor: Many Aeldari units use monofilament weapons, all of which work in a similar fashion by creating a dense monofilament mesh from a complex organo-polymer compound. This is released through thousands of microscopic firing ducts and woven into a net of monofilament wire by spinning gravity clamps. The victim’s own struggles bring about his doom, for the razor-net is so sharp it can reduce an entangled enemy to bloody chunks of flesh in seconds.

Monstrous Creature.flavor: These are towering giants that are capable of crushing a tank–like the Tyranid Carnifex, a creature bioengineered and evolved to become a living battering ram.

Morale Soak.description: Reduces the damage by the target's morale.

Move Through Cover.description: Negates the movement penalty in forests and imperial ruins.
Move Through Cover.flavor: Some warriors are skilled at moving over broken and tangled terrain.

Orphic Starkness.flavor: This inhuman expanse of stone now seems to bend impossibly, filling more space than there is. The Necron flying machines stretch and flicker in and out of existence as they traverse it.

Static Targetting.description: Increases the accuracy against units in cities.
Static Targetting.flavor: The Necrons' technology may have been raised from dusty ancient tombs, but few races in the past 60 million years have matched their prowess in manipulating dimensional variables. No wall, bunker or laser grid is a defense against such weaponry.

Dispersed Targetting.flavor: Human targeting systems tend to focus on accuracy, narrowing the dispersal of a weapon's shots. Counter-intuitively, the more advanced Necron targeting systems spread a weapon's attacks out, yet somehow still increase the chance of each shot to hit.

Preliminary Excavation.flavor: More of the ancient city has been uncovered by the digging slaves, who are now turned to restoring the long-buried buildings.

Unearthed City.flavor: The entirety of the buried necropolis has now been revealed, resplendent in its mind-bending horror.

Slave Enrichment.flavor: Minor modifications to your slaves' bodies and minds enables them to sleep less and work more, for as long as their fragile bodies last.

Dynasty.description: Increases the population limit of cities.

Empyreal Accumulators.flavor: Little has changed on the outside of this baroque sarcophagus—yet, inside its unheimlich interior, dark Cryptek devices are stabilising a much improved device.

Entropic Strike.description: Scales the minimum damage with the hitpoints of the target unit.

Eternity Gate.description: Necron units can teleport to adjacent tiles.
Eternity Gate.flavor: A Monolith's eternity gate is a dimensional corridor between the battlefield and a tomb world, allowing legions of Necron warriors to cross vast distances and enter the fray with a single step.

Gloom Prism.flavor: The gloom prism's energy field creates a zone shrouded from Warp-spawned powers.

Gravity Pulse.description: Reduces the movement of and deals damage to flyers, jetbikes and skimmers in range.
Gravity Pulse.modifiers:
<trait category="Debuff" icon="Actions/Necrons/GravityPulse">
	<modifiers>
		<modifier>
			<conditions>
				<unit>
					<enemy/>
				</unit>
				<unit match="Any">
					<trait name="Flyer"/>
					<trait name="JetPack"/>
					<trait name="Jetbike"/>
					<trait name="Skimmer"/>
				</unit>
			</conditions>
			<effects>
				<movementMax mul="-0.67"/>
			</effects>
		</modifier>
	</modifiers>
	<perTurnModifiers endure="0">
		<modifier>
			<conditions>
				<unit>
					<enemy/>
				</unit>
				<unit match="Any">
					<trait name="Flyer"/>
					<trait name="JetPack"/>
					<trait name="Jetbike"/>
					<trait name="Skimmer"/>
				</unit>
			</conditions>
			<effects>
				<hitpointsFactorFromMax add="-0.1"/>
			</effects>
		</modifier>
	</perTurnModifiers>
</trait>

Reanimation Rituals.flavor: Establishing more efficient protocols for recovering the long-buried Necrons from their tombs reduces the loss from clumsy slave excavators.

Hardwired For Destruction.flavor: The Necrons of the Destroyer Cult are hate-fuelled harvesters of the living, obsessed with the eradication of all sentient beings. They task the Crypteks with modifying their bodies to turn themselves into optimised killing machines. On Gladius Prime, the recently risen Skorpekh Destroyers demonstrate that perfectly, landing brutally accurate blows with their great blades.

Shelter Compression.flavor: By altering the dimensional constraints of each shelter, many more Necrons can be accommodated for repair or maintenance.

Hunters from Hyperspace.description: Teleports to target explored tile and increases damage.
Hunters from Hyperspace.flavor: These deadly marksmen seldom take position with the rest of the army. Instead, they slip sideways out of reality and monitor the conflict from a hyperspace oubliette – a pocket dimension riding the gap between the then and now. The Deathmarks track enemy communication channels, teleport beams and orbital descents in order to select suitably high-profile prey. This done, they exit their oubliette to tag their quarry with the hunter’s mark from which they take their name – an eerie green energy halo that plays about the target’s head in five dimensions.

Immune to Natural Law.description: The unit can move over water, through enemy units and ignores the penalties of rivers and wire weed.

Core Refinements.flavor: With better tools and less constraints, the Crypteks and Canopteks are able to recover a higher proportion of the buried Necrons, faster.

Haunting Inscriptions.flavor: Woe betide any mortal man who gazes on these inscriptions—their sharp edges seem to waver in the corner of the eye, driving fear into human hearts.

Living Metal.flavor: It's understandable why the Necrons build their vehicles from the same living metal as their own bodies, given how durable it is and how well-suited it is to repairing damage sustained in the field.

Baroque Covenant.flavor: More of the Shrine's hidden tale is now revealed, though the story still ends before the Silent King can revenge himself on the voracious Star Gods that stripped his people of their souls.

Necrodermic Blades.flavor: Made from impossibly thin slices of the Necron's utilitarian living metal, these blades pass through most skin, bone and armour with disturbing ease.

Nebuloscope.flavor: This arcane device allows the Tomb Blade's pilot to track his prey through different dimensions, leaving them no place to hide.

Trusted Slaves.flavor: Putting some faith in the enslaved young races of Old One creation and improving their lot might seem foolish, but it increases productivity.

Chronometron.flavor: These eye-shaped devices project a bubble of energy that can alter the flow of time itself, slowing incoming projectiles such that those nearby can simply move out of their path.

Phase Shift Generator.flavor: When a Gauss Pylon is raised from the ground, it creates a temporal bubble altering the local flow of space time. Nearby Necrons can take advantage of this, shifting out of phase with reality to avoid destruction.

Quantum Shielding.flavor: Necron quantum shielding is a marvel of science, existing only at the precise moment of deflection—at all other times there is no indication of its presence. They are, however, temperamental devices, prone to malfunction if overloaded.

Reanimation Protocols.flavor: Necrons have sophisticated self-repair systems that return even critically damaged warriors to the fight.

Reaper.flavor: Where the Flayers suffer the deathcurse of Llandu'gor, the Destroyers' madness derives from the universal fate of all Necrons—the loss of their souls when they took on living metal bodies. In the Destroyers, this drives them to refine themselves more and more, to become closer to perfect weapons—curiously, thus, closer to Aza'gorod, the Nightbringer, the doom of all life.

Cryptek Datastyles.flavor: Dreaming up new technologies is the purview of the Crypteks—and with Datastyles they can access shared information without the risks presented by a direct mind-to-mind connection.

Shield Vane.flavor: Tomb Blades that are deployed directly into the midst of a world's defences are often equipped with additional armour panels.

Sleeping Sentry.description: Increases the damage reduction but prevents the unit from moving or taking an action.

Target Relayed.description: Increases the ranged accuracy of Necrons against the unit.
Target Relayed.flavor: Triarch Stalkers might appear fragile, but their unique Quantum Shielding keeps them in one piece, in order that their Targeting Relay can amplify the firepower of nearby Necrons.

Targeting Relay.description: Temporarily increases the ranged accuracy of Necrons against the target unit.
Targeting Relay.flavor: Triarch Stalkers might appear fragile, but their unique Quantum Shielding keeps them in one piece, in order that their Targeting Relay can amplify the firepower of nearby Necrons.

Canoptek Workers.flavor: Assigning Canoptek constructors to maintain and repair the various long-dormant war machines greatly speeds up their refurbishment.

Wraith Form.flavor: As a Canoptek device, the Wraith was intended to maintain the sleeping Necrons through the millennia they slumbered and was able to dimensionally destabilise itself to repair failing internal components. Now its charges are awoken, it uses the same technology to flit across the battlefield as enemy munitions pass harmlessly through it.

Wraithflight.description: The unit can move over water, through enemy units and ignores the penalties of rivers and wire weed.
Wraithflight.flavor: Their dimensional destabilisation matrix doesn’t just make Wraiths almost impossible to kill—it also allows them to pass through any obstacle, be that rivers, wire weed or even enemy warriors.

Open-Topped.flavor: Some vehicles have only a little armour, making them more vulnerable to damage because of their lightweight construction. However, such vehicles make for excellent assault transports as their passengers can disembark with much greater ease.

Ordnance.description: Increases the armour penetration against vehicles and fortifications. Not usable by infantry after moving.
Ordnance.modifiers:
<trait alwaysVisible="1">
	<modifiers>
		<modifier>
			<conditions>
				<unit>
					<movement equal="0"/>
					<movementMax greater="0"/>
					<noTrait name="Flyer"/>
					<noTrait name="Fortification"/>
					<noTrait name="Relentless"/>
					<noTrait name="SlowAndPurposeful"/>
					<noTrait name="Vehicle"/>
				</unit>
			</conditions>
			<effects>
				<rangedAccuracy min="-999" max="-999"/>
			</effects>
		</modifier>
		<modifier>
			<conditions>
				<encounter>
					<opponent match="Any">
						<trait name="Fortification"/>
						<trait name="Vehicle"/>
					</opponent>
				</encounter>
			</conditions>
			<effects>
				<armorPenetration mul="0.25"/>
			</effects>
		</modifier>
	</modifiers>
</trait>

Orkoid Fungus.description: Restores hitpoints each turn of Ork ground units.
Orkoid Fungus.flavor: Orks have a weirdly symbiotic relationship with the fungus that spreads across their planets—it's genetically identical to them, Squigs and Grots, and all these species tend to emerge from it rather than being born. Ork units depleted by battle would be wise to retreat to these fields to acquire (literally) fresh recruits.

Fungal Forests.description: Restores hitpoints each turn of Ork ground units.
Fungal Forests.flavor: Once the Ork fungal spores are well-established across a planet, they can resemble forests—albeit, comprised of immense mushrooms, spewing out feral Orks, Grots and Squigs.

Bigga Boltz.flavor: Like the Space Marine Kraken bolts, this Mek barrel modification allows this Shoota to hold even larger calibre ammunition, letting the lucky recipient show off by toting an even larger gun that hits even harder.

Bigger Whips.description: Increases the production output of Runtherd Groundz.
Bigger Whips.flavor:
“We's gonna need a bigger whip.”
  — Runtherd Gark Snotsmeer, shortly before a Squiggoth stepped on him

Scrap Hammers.description: Increases the production output of Mek Bitz Yards.
Scrap Hammers.flavor: When there isn't enough small-sized scrap to hand to build their ungainly creations, Mekboys acquire more by devising weird and wonderful machines which ravage the ruins and wreckage of their conquered worlds.

More Dakka.description: Increases the production output of Pile O' Dakkas.
More Dakka.flavor:
“Da best shoota I eva made, dat iz. Loadza barrulz, so dat it's ded shooty. 'Sept dat wun, 'cos dat's da skorcha, dat's burny insted. Yeah, good an' propa. An' da bullitz is 'splosiv…dey goez boom inna fings wot you'z shootin.' An' dat button dere…dat's da best bit. Wot it duz, see, iz…iz…oh, zog. Nah, it's nuffin' boss. Nah, you'z don't need ta see wot dat button duz…'onist. Don't push it!”
  — Last words, Nazdakka Boomsnik, Mek

Bodge Jobs.description: Increases the production output of Kults ov Speed.
Bodge Jobs.flavor: Most Ork technology shouldn't work—vital components are often missing or the device is simply impossible. The Ork's single-minded belief—realised in the form of the Waaagh! energy that surrounds them—fills in the gaps. That's why speeding up the production of Ork vehicles and weaponry has almost no effect upon its quality…

Bust Heads.flavor:
“Oi, you zogging berks! Stop 'itting each uvver and start 'itting the beakies! Or do I have to start 'itting… you? I ain't askin'—I's tellin'. Geddit?”
  — Da Rok, Ork Nob

Kraklin Gubbinz.flavor: Green and red lightning arcs between the intricate prongs of these power amplification devices, frying any Greenskin who wanders too near. It's quite the spectator sport, but the technology is missing key components so couldn't possibly bear out the Meks' claims of its increase in energy output—save for the Orks' reality-altering faith that it does.

Boss Speakers.description: Increases the production output of Scrap Shedz.
Boss Speakers.flavor:
“Naw, I don't want zogging tweeterz. I want gorkawooferz… wunz that go up ta eleven!”
  — Bleeding Ears Merfnik, Goff Warlord and Rocka

Big Shinies.flavor:
“I don't knows what dems is, but I wants 'em.”
  — Warboss Flashgrub Nitwiz, gazing upon the hammered gold doors of the Basilica Imperialis on Catiline VII

Trophy Poles.flavor: There's nothing that so stirs up the vim of an Ork as the sight of their defeated enemies (or their remaining parts) strung up high for all to see.

Deep Diggaz.flavor: Using the Mek's latest contraptions, the Ork shacks and forges now extend deep beneath the city's surface. Sure, the occasional collapse drags Orks screaming into the depths, but it's worth it for the extra legroom.

Finking Rooms.flavor: Given that technology is wired into the genes of normal Orks, a smart Warboss will find that dedicating space, manpower and time to locking his Mekz inside a small room full of scrap and ordering them come up with some really good Dakka invariably pays off.

Slum Town.flavor: Outside each fortress' original walls, a slum town of Gretchin, Squigs, Snotlings and low-tier Orks has sprung up, whilst the insidious green fungus has spread everywhere, remaking this world in the Orks' genetic image.

Shanty City.flavor: The Warboss' fame has spread across the entire planet, with the invisible Waaagh! energies paralleling its path. Wherever Orks are freshly-spawned, they feel the irresistible tugging towards the Warboss' cities, which are now sprawled across the nearby landscape in endless slums and shanties.

Rapid Decomposition.description: Causes units to create orkoid fungus when they die.
Rapid Decomposition.flavor:
“Exhibit 27: a single 'spore' of xenos species #0451 'Ork'. Acolytes, you should note the fungoid texture and microhomuncular structures. We theorise that these 'spores' generate new 'Orks' in any sufficiently fertile setting. When an Ork reaches maturity (typically 30 minutes after emergence) it emits these constantly—but they are released en masse at the moment of death. Please don't drop it.”
  — Lecture transcripts, Grigomen “Orklover” Delr, Rogue Trader and amateur Xenologist
Rapid Decomposition.modifiers:
<trait category="Buff">
	<onUnitDisappearedModifiers>
		<modifier visible="0">
			<effects>
				<addFeature duration="3" name="OrkoidFungus"/>
			</effects>
		</modifier>
		<modifier visible="0" requiredUpgrade="Orks/CreatePermanentOrkoidFungusOnDeath">
			<effects>
				<addFeature name="OrkoidFungus"/>
			</effects>
		</modifier>
	</onUnitDisappearedModifiers>
</trait>

Cybork Implants.description: Increases the damage and damage reduction.
Cybork Implants.modifiers:
<trait category="Buff" icon="Actions/Orks/CyborkImplants" rankMax="2">
	<modifiers>
		<modifier>
			<effects>
				<damage mulMin="0.05" mulMax="0.15"/>
				<feelNoPainDamageReduction addMin="0.05" addMax="0.15"/>
			</effects>
		</modifier>
	</modifiers>
</trait>

Extra Bitz.description: Reduces the food, ore and energy upkeep.
Extra Bitz.modifiers:
<trait category="Buff" icon="Actions/Orks/ExtraBitz" rankMax="2">
	<modifiers>
		<modifier>
			<conditions>
				<unit>
					<allied/>
					<noTrait name="Fortification"/>
					<noTrait name="Vehicle"/>
				</unit>
			</conditions>
			<effects>
				<energyUpkeep mulMin="-0.25" mulMax="-0.75"/>
				<foodUpkeep mulMin="-0.25" mulMax="-0.75"/>
				<oreUpkeep mulMin="-0.25" mulMax="-0.75"/>
			</effects>
		</modifier>
	</modifiers>
</trait>

Experimental Procedure.description: Increases the damage and damage reduction.

Flyboss.description: Increases the ranged accuracy against flyers, jetbikes and skimmers.
Flyboss.flavor: Flybosses are ace pilots who have survived more dogfights than they can count (even when using their toes).
Flyboss.modifiers:
<trait alwaysVisible="1" category="Buff">
	<modifiers>
		<modifier>
			<conditions>
				<encounter>
					<opponent match="Any">
						<trait name="Flyer"/>
						<trait name="JetPack"/>
						<trait name="Jetbike"/>
						<trait name="Skimmer"/>
					</opponent>
				</encounter>
			</conditions>
			<effects>
				<rangedAccuracy add="2"/>
			</effects>
		</modifier>
	</modifiers>
</trait>

Gitfinda.description: Increases the ranged accuracy if the unit remains stationary.
Gitfinda.flavor: These can be elaborate ocular bionics, monocular head-sets, oversized telescopes, or Mork knows what else. The function of a gitfinda is to improve the accuracy of its user to near-average levels.

Green Tide.flavor: Orks are pretty damn hard to kill. Orks seemingly killed in one battle often return in the next, either fixed up by a Mad Dok or simply miraculously healed—and tougher and stronger for the experience.

Grot Gunner.description: Increases the accuracy of Big Shootas and Twin-Linked Big Shootas.
Grot Gunner.modifiers:
<trait alwaysVisible="1" category="Buff">
	<modifiers>
		<modifier>
			<conditions>
				<weapon match="Any">>
					<type name="BigShoota"/>
					<type name="TwinLinkedBigShoota"/>
				</weapon>
			</conditions>
			<effects>
				<accuracy add="2"/>
			</effects>
		</modifier>
	</modifiers>
</trait>

Kustom Force Field.flavor: These bizarre devices are powered by crackling energy-coils and project invisible bubbles of energy that shield nearby Orks from incoming fire.

Bigga Choppas.flavor: When Orks think about upgrades, they don't think very hard. Mega-armour, Gigashootas… and bigga choppas. If you can carry it, you can swing it, and if you can swing it, you can hit someone with it.

Might Makes Right.flavor: The Orks only really feel alive when they're in a Waaagh! and a Waaagh! can only thrive through constant battle. As long as Orks are fighting, the Waaagh! should grow.

Prophet of the Waaagh!.description: Grants influence based on the upkeep when attacking.

Scavenger.description: Grants ore when killing an enemy.
Scavenger.flavor: Orks aren't known for their love of labour, preferring to sit around between battles picking bits of Squig out of their mouths and fighting each other. So rather than mine minerals from the ground, they tend to salvage them from, well, anywhere. Or rather their Grot underlings do.

Warbike Turbo-Boost.description: Increases the movement and ranged damage reduction.
Warbike Turbo-Boost.flavor:
“‘Fasta, fasta! Dey can’t ‘it wot dey can’t sees! Smack all dem turbos!”
  — Last words of Da Rok, Ork Nob and erstwhile warbiker

Warpath.description: Increases the number of melee attacks of the Weirdboy and adjacent Mob Rule allied units.
Warpath.flavor: The Weirdboy disperses the Waaagh! energy coursing through his frame into the Ork warriors around him, stirring their already bellicose, warlike nature to roaring fever pitch.

Outpost.description: Increases the damage reduction and the healing rate of allied units. Increases the ranged damage reduction of infantry units.
Outpost.modifiers:
<trait category="Buff" icon="Features/Outpost">
	<modifiers>
		<modifier>
			<conditions>
				<player>
					<noFaction name="Neutral"/>
				</player>
				<unit>
					<allied/>
					<noTrait name="City"/>
				</unit>
			</conditions>
			<effects>
				<cityDamageReduction add="0.17"/>
				<healingRate mul="0.5"/>
			</effects>
		</modifier>
		<modifier>
			<conditions>
				<player>
					<noFaction name="Neutral"/>
				</player>
				<unit>
					<noTrait name="City"/>
					<noTrait name="Flyer"/>
					<noTrait name="Fortification"/>
					<noTrait name="MonstrousCreature"/>
					<noTrait name="Vehicle"/>
				</unit>
			</conditions>
			<effects>
				<rangedDamageReduction add="0.17"/>
			</effects>
		</modifier>		
	</modifiers>
</trait>

Outflank.description: Increases the accuracy when adjacent to an allied unit.
Outflank.flavor: The best way to surprise an enemy is to strike from an unexpected quarter.

Pinned.description: Reduces the movement and ranged accuracy, increases the ranged damage reduction and prevents the unit from doing overwatch attacks.
Pinned.flavor: Coming under fire without knowing where the shots are coming from, or having ordnance rain down from the skies, can shake the resolve of even the bravest warriors, making them dive flat and cling to whatever cover presents itself.
Pinned.modifiers:
<trait category="Debuff">
	<modifiers>
		<modifier>
			<conditions>
				<unit>
					<noTrait name="Bike"/>
					<noTrait name="Fearless"/>
					<noTrait name="Fortification"/>
					<noTrait name="Jetbike"/>
					<noTrait name="Eldar/KhaineAwakened"/>
					<noTrait name="MonstrousCreature"/>
					<noTrait name="Tyranids/SynapseLink"/>
					<noTrait name="Vehicle"/>
					<noTrait name="Zealot"/>
				</unit>
			</conditions>
			<effects>
				<movementMax mul="-0.67"/>
				<rangedAccuracy mul="-0.17"/>
				<rangedDamageReduction add="0.17"/>
			</effects>
		</modifier>
		<modifier visible="0">
			<conditions>
				<unit>
					<noTrait name="Bike"/>
					<noTrait name="Fearless"/>
					<noTrait name="Fortification"/>
					<noTrait name="Jetbike"/>
					<noTrait name="Eldar/KhaineAwakened"/>
					<noTrait name="MonstrousCreature"/>
					<noTrait name="Tyranids/SynapseLink"/>
					<noTrait name="Vehicle"/>
					<noTrait name="Zealot"/>
				</unit>
			</conditions>
			<effects>
				<preventOverwatch add="1"/>
			</effects>
		</modifier>
	</modifiers>
</trait>

Pinning.description: Temporarily reduces the movement of the target fearful infantry unit and prevents it from doing overwatch attacks.
Pinning.flavor: Coming under fire without knowing where the shots are coming from, or having ordnance rain down from the skies, can shake the resolve of even the bravest warriors, making them dive flat and cling to whatever cover presents itself.
Pinning.modifiers:
<trait alwaysVisible="1" category="Buff">
	<onCombatOpponentModifiers>
		<modifier>
			<conditions>
				<encounter>
					<self>
						<attacking/>
					</self>
					<opponent>
						<noAttacking/>
						<noTrait name="Bike"/>
						<noTrait name="Fearless"/>
						<noTrait name="Fortification"/>
						<noTrait name="Jetbike"/>
						<noTrait name="Eldar/KhaineAwakened"/>
						<noTrait name="MonstrousCreature"/>
						<noTrait name="Tyranids/SynapseLink"/>
						<noTrait name="Vehicle"/>
						<noTrait name="Zealot"/>
					</opponent>
				</encounter>
			</conditions>
			<effects>
				<addTrait name="Pinned" duration="1"/>
			</effects>
		</modifier>
	</onCombatOpponentModifiers>
</trait>

Poisoned.description: Increases the damage against infantry and monstrous creature units.
Poisoned.flavor: There are many virulent and lethal poisons in the dark future. It is simplicity itself to adapt such toxins for battlefield use. It does not matter whether they coat weapon-blades or bullets, or are secreted by alien monstrosities – all are lethal.
Poisoned.modifiers:
<trait alwaysVisible="1" category="Buff" rankMax="4" visibilityCategory="Weapon">
	<modifiers>
		<modifier>
			<conditions>
				<encounter>
					<opponent>
						<noTrait name="Fortification"/>
						<noTrait name="Vehicle"/>
					</opponent>
				</encounter>
			</conditions>
			<effects>
				<damage addMin="0.25" addMax="4.25"/>
			</effects>
		</modifier>
	</modifiers>
</trait>

Power of the Machine Spirit.flavor: The interface between this vehicle's advanced machine spirit and its fire control mechanisms allows the crew to target foes with incredible accuracy.

Preferred Enemy.flavor: Many of the galaxy's warriors train hard to overcome a particular foe, allowing them to predict the enemy's battlestances and thus land a blow or shot with greater ease.

Psychic Block.description: Blocks the damage and effects of the next enemy psychic power.

Psychneuein Infest.description: Causes the target unit to spawn a Psychneuein when killed.

Psyker.flavor: Psykers are battlefield mystics who harness the power of the Warp.

Rage.flavor: Bloodlust is a powerful weapon on the battlefield, spurring a warrior to hack his foes apart in a flurry of mindless (but eminently satisfying) carnage.

Rampage.description: Increases the attacks when there are more enemies than allies in adjacent tiles.
Rampage.flavor: For some warriors, being outnumbered is not a cause for despair, but a call to set about their foes with a berserk counter-attack.

Rapid Fire.description: Doubles the attacks at half range.

Recovery Gear.flavor: Many crews load their vehicles with collections of tools, tow cables and other useful kit that can make the difference between digging an immobilized vehicle out of a tight spot or having to abandon it to its fate.

Red Paint Job.flavor: Orks believe that a vehicle painted red can outstrip a similar vehicle that isn't. As odd as it may seem, they're not wrong.

Refractor Field.flavor: Often carried by high-ranking officers and Imperial heroes, shimmering refractor fields refract incoming energy around their bearer, batting aside blasts and swinging blades that would otherwise lay them low.

Regeneration.flavor: Some units have the ability to recover from horrendous wounds and injuries that should have proven fatal.

Relentless.description: Negates the penalty for heavy, ordnance and salvo weapons.
Relentless.flavor: Relentless warriors are strong of arm—nothing can slow their implacable advance.

Relic Plating.flavor: Occasionally a crew will achieve an empathic relationship with the machine spirit of their battle tank. When such a crew perishes, their remains may be interred within their vehicle, spirits lingering protectively to drive away the baleful energies of the void.

Rending.description: Increases the damage and armour penetration.
Rending.flavor: Some weapons can inflict critical strikes against which no armour can protect.

Repulsor Grid.description: Increases the ranged damage reduction and returns ranged damage from weapons that are not blast, template or witchfire back to the attacker.

Rites of War.flavor: Honour-bound by sacred oaths of fealty to the Imperium, the Chaplain and his warriors vow before the Chapter and the Emperor to secure victory at any cost.

Rosarius.flavor: A rosarius is worn by Space Marine Chaplains for protection and as a symbol of office. It emits a protective energy field around the wearer capable of deflecting blows and shots that would smash a ferrocrete bunker. It is said that the stronger the bearer's belief in the might of the Emperor, the stronger a rosarius' force field will be.

Ruins Stealth.description: Increases the ranged damage reduction while in imperial ruins.

Salvo.description: Halves the attacks and range if the unit has moved.

Savant Interlocution.description: Increases the ranged accuracy against flyers and skimmers when adjacent to an allied Hunter.
Savant Interlocution.modifiers:
<trait alwaysVisible="1">
	<modifiers>
		<modifier>
			<conditions>
				<encounter>
					<opponent match="Any">
						<trait name="Flyer"/>
						<trait name="Skimmer"/>
					</opponent>
				</encounter>
				<unit>
					<unitsInRange count="1" range="1">
						<allied/>
						<type name="SpaceMarines/Hunter"/>
					</unitsInRange>
				</unit>
			</conditions>
			<effects>
				<rangedAccuracy add="4"/>
			</effects>
		</modifier>
	</modifiers>
</trait>

Savant Lock.description: Increases the accuracy against flyers, jetbikes and skimmers.
Savant Lock.modifiers:
<trait alwaysVisible="1">
	<modifiers>
		<modifier>
			<conditions>
				<encounter>
					<opponent match="Any">
						<trait name="Flyer"/>
						<trait name="JetPack"/>
						<trait name="Jetbike"/>
						<trait name="Skimmer"/>
					</opponent>
				</encounter>
			</conditions>
			<effects>
				<rangedAccuracy add="2"/>
			</effects>
		</modifier>
	</modifiers>
</trait>

Seeker Missile.description: Reduced range against targets not acquired by markerlight. Does not require line of sight against targets acquired by markerlight.
Seeker Missile.flavor: Seeker missiles are one-shot weapons usually guided to their targets by markerlights, though they can be fired independently as well.
Seeker Missile.modifiers:
<trait alwaysVisible="1" icon="Weapons/SeekerMissile">
	<modifiers>
		<modifier visible="0">
			<conditions>
				<encounter>
					<opponent>
						<trait name="Tau/TargetAcquired"/>
					</opponent>
				</encounter>
			</conditions>
			<effects>
				<ignoreLineOfSight add="1"/>
			</effects>
		</modifier>
		<modifier visible="0">
			<conditions>
				<encounter>
					<opponent>
						<noTrait name="Tau/TargetAcquired"/>
					</opponent>
				</encounter>
			</conditions>
			<effects>
				<rangeMax add="-1"/>
			</effects>
		</modifier>
	</modifiers>
</trait>

Seeking.description: Increases the ranged accuracy against flyers.

Shaken.description: Reduces the accuracy and increases the damage taken.

Shielded.flavor: Some warriors are protected by more than mere physical armour. They may be shielded by force fields, enveloped in mystical energies or have a constitution that can shrug off hits that would put holes in a battle tank.

Shop.description: Allows hero units to purchase and sell items.

Shred.flavor: Some weapons and warriors strike in a flurry of blows, tearing flesh asunder in a series of brutal strikes.

Shrouded.flavor: The source of the darkness around these warriors matters not—only a lucky shot has any chance of piercing the shroud that hides them from view.

Siege Masters.description: Increases the damage against enemy units in cities and fortifications.
Siege Masters.modifiers:
<trait alwaysVisible="1" category="Buff" icon="Actions/SiegeMasters">
	<modifiers>
		<modifier>
			<conditions>
				<encounter>
					<opponent>
						<trait name="City"/>
					</opponent>
				</encounter>
			</conditions>
			<effects>
				<damage mul="0.33"/>
			</effects>
		</modifier>
		<modifier visible="0">
			<conditions>
				<encounter>
					<opponent>
						<noTrait name="City"/>
						<trait name="Fortification"/>
					</opponent>
				</encounter>
			</conditions>
			<effects>
				<damage mul="0.33"/>
			</effects>
		</modifier>
	</modifiers>
</trait>

Siege Shield.description: Increases the armour and reduces the movement penalty in forests and imperial ruins.
Siege Shield.flavor: Many Vindicators are equipped with an enormous bulldozer blade, allowing them to shoulder aside battlefield detritus without risk.

Signum.flavor: The signum is a communication device that quickly processes and broadcasts targeting data. This ancient piece of technology allows one member of a Space Marine squad to fire with even greater accuracy, battering vital targets with a hail of unerring shots.

Anchorite Sarcophagus.flavor: To those Repentia who not only fled, but betrayed their Sisters in battle, an even worse fate awaits. After being wired into the crucible of their Mortifier they are further entombed behind thick adamantine casing. This sarcophagus protects their tortured bodies from incoming fire and desperately swung blades, denying them the release of death.

Angelic Visage.flavor: Beatifically smiling, Zephyrim deflect the strikes of their foes with fluid grace before landing a killing blow of their own, typically with a point-blank headshot from a bolt pistol or a strike of their power sword.

Anguish Of The Unredeemed.flavor: Mortifiers blaze a trail of destruction with their flamers before charging headlong into the foe, guilt and pain driving them on, heedless of danger. Even as they die, they strike at their enemy, striving for redemption with every moment.

Armour Of Saint Katherine.flavor: Ever since this revered suit of armour was anointed with a vial of blood from the martyred Saint Katherine it has been believed to have sacred powers of protection.

Furious Fusillade.flavor:
“The right attack, carefully placed, can defeat the most overwhelming of enemies. However, if we do not know the right attack? Then an overwhelming, inchoate assault will hit the right spot, eventually…”
  — Canoness Vandire, In Nomine Strategi

Avenging Zeal.flavor:
“The loss of our Sisters and auxiliaries saddened us—but encouraged us to redouble our efforts.”
  — Unknown remembrancer, Gospel of the Webway

Berserk Killing Machine.flavor: Tormented by neuro-agoniser arrays that amplify her self-loathing and divorced from her Sisters’ prayers by an enclosing baffle around her head, the unfortunate pilot’s spiritual suffering fuels the Mortifier. They storm forward as terrifying shock troops, before crashing into their foe.

Bloody Resolution.flavor: The Sisters of the Adepta Sororitas do not give in to despair when their leaders are slain. Instead, the blood of these martyred heroes only strengthens their resolve, the sacrifice inspiring them to great acts of heroism.

Catechism of Repugnance.description: Increases the ranged accuracy and ranged armor penetration of the target Adepta Sororitas allied unit.
Catechism of Repugnance.flavor: With the holy bolter we shall cleanse the mutant, the alien and the heretic. With the Emperor’s gift do we deliver our hatred of the defiler.
Catechism of Repugnance.modifiers:
<trait category="Buff" rankMax="2">
	<modifiers>
		<modifier>
			<effects>
				<rangedAccuracy addMin="1" addMax="3"/>
				<rangedArmorPenetration addMin="1" addMax="3"/>
			</effects>
		</modifier>
	</modifiers>
</trait>

Novitiates Recruitment.flavor: The Ork invasion and subsequent war on Gladius Prime left many, many orphans. Sending missionaries and preachers into the wastes to recruit for the armies of the Imperium will bolster our city’s growth.

Preceptory Annexes.flavor: Given the numbers of refugees pouring into the Preceptory from the ruined hives and wastelands of Gladius Prime, the Canoness Superior has ordered that we sanctify new land for use, bringing any natives into the fold—willingly or not.

Sanctuary Fortress.flavor: The Preceptory is more of a city now, resembling the hive cities that once dotted the planet’s surface. Beneath its bulk lies an undercity, above it tower spires and chantries. Perhaps only the Fortress-Monasteries of the Adeptus Astartes rival it in scale and holy adornment.

Divine Deliverance.description: This unit and adjacent allied Adepta Sororitas units cause attacked units to lose morale.
Divine Deliverance.flavor: Enemy warlords tremble before the divine majesty of one blessed by the Emperor, and their minions quake before the booming onslaught of such a warrior’s companions.
Divine Deliverance.modifiers:
<trait category="Buff" rankMax="2" icon="Actions/SistersOfBattle/DivineDeliverance">
	<modifiers>
		<modifier>
			<conditions>
				<unit>
					<allied/>
					<faction name="SistersOfBattle"/>
				</unit>
			</conditions>
		</modifier>
	</modifiers>
	<onCombatOpponentModifiers>
		<modifier>
			<conditions>
				<encounter>
					<self>
						<allied/>
						<attacking/>
						<faction name="SistersOfBattle"/>
					</self>
					<opponent>
						<noAttacking/>
					</opponent>
				</encounter>
			</conditions>
			<effects>
				<morale addMin="-1" addMax="-3"/>
			</effects>
		</modifier>
	</onCombatOpponentModifiers>
</trait>

Eternal Crusade.flavor:
“And we shall not rest, for the God-Emperor’s eye is on us. He sees every soul saved and knows that the number imperilled far outweighs it. We cannot stop, we cannot slow—ours is an eternal crusade.”
  — Canoness Vandire, In Memoriam De Virtute

Expert Fighters.flavor: In most strike wings a handful of aircrafts are flown by veteran pilotes. These fighter aces are truly dangerous foes, able to predict the reaction of their prey with uncanny precision. Few of them survive beyond one or two campaigns as they draw the most dangerous missions where only the most experienced prevail.

Flank Speed.description: Increases the movement, but prevents the use of ranged weapons.
Flank Speed.flavor:
“One should not question the nobility of Questor Imperialis. But for faith, none can match the Knight-Lancer, which goes into battle armed only with a spear and its own prodigious speed, praying that it makes it to the enemy lines. It is a fine match for our forces.”
  — Canoness Vandire, In Nomine Strategi

Enhanced Ordnance.flavor:
“Over the shells of the Castigator, we sprinkle the soil of holy Terra, raise our voices in prayer, and genuflect before the Shrine of St Katherine. Then we add 25% more explosive to each shell and cap them with adamantium.”
  — Canoness Vandire, In Nomine Strategi
